Reviews.Title: “Dirty, confusing Tremont Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinestate221
Reviews.Content: It costs me 160 dollars to stay one night at this Tremont Plaza Hotel. The bath tub was clogged, water didn't drain down for literally 3, 4 hours. When I called front desk (according to the paper on the phone), it's actually NOt the front desk. It's some restaurant. They transferred me twice to front desk and nobody answered the phone. The carpet was dirty. The TV is actually all the way on the left side of the bed, so you can't really watch TV. The carpet was dirty. There is a mirror right in front of the toilet. so every time you sit on the toilet, it's so unpleasant to see yourself doing number one or number two. Awful!! Also, there are Grand Tremont and Tremont Plaza Hotel (which is in the same building) but different entrance and it's very inconvienient to stay at one place and then go to a different place for conference or wedding. Lastly, I got food poison from eating the food there. Not a great experience at all when you spent 160 dollars a night

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerTW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend last summer and the staff treated me with no respect and talked down to me like I was a child. When I checked out the woman at the front desk told me to wait while she got my $50 deposit to return to me. She then helped other guests in line and ignored me for 20 minutes. When I finally got her attention back she acted surprised that I did not leave without my deposit being returned. After a few more minutes of waiting she slowly retrieved my deposit and handed it to me without saying anything or looking at me. Other than the rude service the hotel was average but very expensive. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and value!!!”
Reviews.Author: AKB1221
Reviews.Content: I stayed just for one night and had such a great and easy and seamless experience that I'm only EVER staying here when I travel to Baltimore (which will be often). Wonderful and helpful staff. Easy check in. Clean and spacious. Great location. Unbelievable value.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious downtown Baltimore hotel”
Reviews.Author: librarian73
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here for many years. The accommodations are one-bedroom suites with lots of space. The staff is very accommodating and helpful and the price is right. The rooms include a full kitchen. You are within easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor and Cambden Yard. I almost feel like I am in an apartment instead of a hotel - very relaxing. There is also a small deli and carry out near the lobby. It is also a very quiet hotel. Fitness facilities are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tdijetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our five year old while attending a wedding at the Tremont Grand (the buildings are connected). I used to live in Baltimore so I am familiar with the city and hadn't heard much about this hotel. I wasn't expecting much, judging from the chaos we experienced at check-in. There was a wait to even pull into the line to wait in line for valet parking, and inside things weren't much better. However, once we cleared the first floor, things were much much better (and stayed that way). We could see the entire harbor and more from our 31st floor room. Room was spacious, clean, and came with free wifi and bottled water. No strange smells, which as a frequent traveler I always brace myself for. Everything in the room worked. There were several weddings going on so we heard people coming back to their rooms at midnight or so but nothing too awful. The next day, we found that all the wedding guests were abuzz about the comfie sheets and beds! We loved the deli downstairs. Valet guys were great, as we were in and out. Front desk staff were very helpful. Full grocery store around the corner. At check out, staff gave me a print out with custom directions. Location is very convenient - you can walk south to the harbor (we walked to the National Aquarium) or north to the hip shops/cafes in Mt. Vernon. If you're not a walker, they offer a free shuttle service pretty much anywhere you'd want to go within the city (Fell's Point, Inner Harbor, etc.). Minor complaint - at one point two out of four elevators were down, but it was repaired quickly. And as I mentioned, check in area is small and can get crowded. Bottom line - we'd stay again. Great value (Tremont web site rate), great room, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Brylczyk
Reviews.Content: Clean big suite. Free shuttle service. Front desk seemed a little under staffed at times. Overall would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and a fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johndol
Reviews.Content: We were in Baltimore 2 nights and 3 days and enjoyed this hotel very very much. The shuttle was convenient to use and the staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “REVISITING THE TREMONT HOTEL IN BALTIMORE MD”
Reviews.Author: r s
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Tremont Hotel in Baltmore last year and it was an amazing, perfect experience so, I have just made reservations to stay there again. It proves that "experiences do count" for repeat stays. I am really looking forward to this future trip and to spend time at the Tremont once again. Rose Smith NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deannpa
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Tremont Plaza for a weekend getaway. The room was very spacious, comfortable and very clean (I am picky). The furnishings were top notch and the staff was wonderful. It was a short, pleasant walk to the Inner Harbor. We would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: Mel S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tremont twice over the past month and half. Both times over a week. In my opinion, this hotel not only has comfortable rooms, is clean, and is located in a nice part of the city. But has the kindest and most friendliest staff. I have never felt so comfortable staying at a hotel. My husband was in Johns Hopkins, which has been very stressful. I was there alone and had to leave our children home with Grandma, miss work, etc etc point is, not a happy trip. And I feel that because the staff at the Tremont were so sincere in their kindness, helped me get through a tough time for me. A big thank you to whole staff at the Tremont. All the shuttle drivers, the front desk staff, the valet/Doormen, Andre(you were especially great) and the ladies that work in the deli. Thanks again. You all deserve the best. Not one bad apple in the bunch. :)

Reviews.Title: “More in Balt”
Reviews.Author: santjordi
Reviews.Content: I was put up here for work and very pleasantly surprised. A very large room with a seating are and kitchenette. I don't know if they considered this a mini suite, but I do. Stunning views of Baltimore on 25th floor. The staff in the Deli were inattentive, but not sure they're hotel or whether seperately owned. Overall, a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good restaurant, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: MSLovell
Reviews.Content: Stay here whenever I'm in Baltimore. Rooms are spacious, quiet, clean. I like the 'cafe' on the first floor where I can pick up something to eat when I arrive late and work in the room. Service personnel polite, helpful and quick cab service when I return to airport!

Reviews.Title: “New Yrs 30th Birthday Surprise Bust!!!”
Reviews.Author: gapgirl2006
Reviews.Content: If your looking for something special, a pampered feeling, or something that isn't your run of the mill hotel do not stay here. The hotel is very poorly staffed so be prepared to wait, not have your needs met, or feel like your in for a treat. My sister usually stays here when she works on call @ Hopkins but had to cancel at last minute due to my sickly nephew..so I hoped on this deal.My BF and I "went away" for the weekend for my b-day (New Yrs) 2011. and he said he had called ahead for some basic suprises in the room(rose pedals, cake, and balloons) to be there for our arrival. They were not able to do as promised. We noticed during check in a rather large amount of young people racing through the lobby at that point I assumed they were having a hotel party. At check in it was the worst. They had me sign some smoking policy paper with a $$deductable, boy oh boy and at that point we were able to find the a/c broke, I need air a little air circulating because of allergy problems That took about another 1/2 hour to fix. No apologies or deductions for their error on the b-day suprise or a/c issue. The bed was sooo uncomfortable, the plumbing noise in the bathroom unbearable. Check out was even a bigger hassle, they actually sent housekeeping to "sniff" the room before I could get my cash back, what the hell, she literally inhaled for a scent check. TOTALLY UNBELIEVEABLE!! I see from some reviews they have some done some updating and renovations, but with the experience I had I'm way too scared to try this place again. What a way to bring in a landmark 30th Birthday & New Years-very disappoining!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the shuttle times”
Reviews.Author: Turtlesaf
Reviews.Content: This place pretends to have a shuttle to Johns Hopkins every half hour in the morning. It doesn't!! The driver leaves whenever he decides it's time to go. I was told there is a shuttle at 8am everyday and twice it left ten minutes before then and I was left waiting until the '8:30' shuttle. Other than that, rooms are decent, lots of space, and fairly clean. Not too bad for the price, as long as you don't rely on the shuttles to get somewhere at a given time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and location!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business--incredible experience! Great amenities, large and clean rooms, friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laurence1001
Reviews.Content: My client booked the room for me there. The room was huge, almost a suite with a nook with refrigerator, microwave, and sink. I don't know if it was actually a suite or just a standard room. Very clean, well-maintained, helpful staff. Very quiet at night. I'd stay again, no problem. Be sure to check out the incredibly ornate meeting rooms in the attached Tremont Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff of any hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKREEBER
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont Plaza for two weeks in June 2011. Conditions weren't ideal - my husband was being operated on at Johns Hopkins and the hotel was undergoing an outside renovation which closed its pool. So you might think I'd have a blah impression of this place. Quite the contrary.! The staff here, - managers, doormen, room service, deli etc- are the nicest of any hotel I can think of. They got me through a terrible time and made me feel like one of the family. Their shuttle to Johns Hopkins was really convenient and they are right on the route of the city's free tourist shuttle buses so getting anywhere is easy. My high-floor suite was comfortable and had a marvelous view; the bed was wonderful. The hotel is part of an historic Masonic building complex which hosts receptions and weddings and seeing these beautiful rooms was an additional bonus. Baltimore is an amazing city - wonderful free art museums, a wide variety of interesting architecture, spectacular food and the nicest friendliest people of any major city I can think of. I hope to return to the Tremont Plaza with my healthy husband for a vacation very soon. Thank you, Tremont Plaza, for being a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Venue for a party or wedding or reception”
Reviews.Author: kitpattrainor
Reviews.Content: This past week, I held my wife's 50th birthday party at the Tremont Plaza Hotel's historic function venue, the former Masonic Lodge, which has several floors with different rooms and sizes for small or large groups. We held our buffet dinner party for 45 guests in the Edinburgh Room which is designed to look like a room in Roslyn Castle in Scotland, I was told. Each room in the venue is decorated differently and reflects the Masonic influence. The website provided good photos of each function room. The catering staff was excellent and I was very impressed with their responsiveness. I would say that initially I did not receive responses, and being from Hong Kong, I alerted the banquet staff to check with their IT Dept. which they did and they found it was a problem with their ISP, which threw all HK emails into a Trash box. Once this was fixed, communications became excellent. So if you are communicating from an overseas location, you may want to keep this in mind. We chose wines we wanted to have served and the Banquet Staff was able to find and order these wines for us. We received a lot of positive compliments on the Sextant Menu we chose, especially the chicken and the crab cakes. Our guests went back for seconds. There was very little food left over. The Banquet staff has a good selection of colors for tablecloths and napkins. The Banquet staff manager (Kathleen) with whom I worked was fabulous in offering suggestions for table decorations and I really appreciated her hard work. Her staff was excellent and always present when needed. They wrapped up all of the desserts for me as well as the cake to take home at the end of the night. Everything which the staff set up and provided was first class and I would not hesitate to go back again or to recommend the venue to anyone wishing a one of a kind feeling in any of these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jodee h
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our weekend stay at the Tremont: room was very pleasant (comfy bed!) and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. I'd suggest going to another location for a bar if what you're looking for is liveliness, as this one was not so (!), but other than that, I have nothing but positives to write.

Reviews.Title: “For Patients@Mercy This is your BEST BET!”
Reviews.Author: Tropinkalscom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times and each time the room has been nice, clean and spacious. They are renovating but it has not bothered me. The deli next door is very convenient. The hotel staff is extremely accommodating.They are used to seeing Patients and their Families from Mercy Medical Center which is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not 4star..”
Reviews.Author: RRGGPM
Reviews.Content: Location is good, but they really need to finish renovation. Carpet in rooms needs changing ASAP. Pumping in bathrooms needs work from bathtube water backing up to old shower head. No vanity space in bathroom. Bed and linens were nice, public parking is ok.Room rate is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid S
Reviews.Content: You can tell from the exterior of the building that this is a historic building. It is also the reason why the room is SPACIOUS! Me and my friend were staying in 25 floor. Because the building is located in old city center, the topography is higher compared with the newer hotels located at harbor area. The view from our room was wonderful. The flaw is the bathroom facility is comparatively old, and the toilet was making leaking noise when I stayed. But in general, the staff was friendly, room is big, nice and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: ChiefJack
Reviews.Content: Stepping into the lobby of the Tremont Plaza Hotel i was warmly greeted by staff. Although later at night reception took longer than most hotels. I attribute that to the depth of the information given by the reception desk staff. Hotel lobby finishes were starting wear, you have to take the elevator to get to any hotel amenities (restaurant, lounge, etc.) "High floor room, no problem." Set wake up call at desk, "no problem". Want help with bags, no..."no problem". Where is the gym, "fourth floor." "We are an all suites hotel"... Southern hospitality in a hotel south of the mason-dixon line... i am always concerned about elevator wait time with a high floor room in a slightly older hotel. THe front desk assured me that the elevators are quick. Even with two large events in the attached meeting venue "The Grand" she was correct. No time wasted praying for an elevator car to arrive, even during the morning rush. My room on the 33rd floor was easy to find (only 7-8 rooms on a floor). Nicely appointed, and huge. The front desk wasn't kidding when they said it was 'all' suites. The kitchenette is what you see when first entering. Two TV's one in sitting area and one in the bedroom. Ipod alarm clock. It has all the comforts you expect in a business hotel. I must remark that the Tremont has one of the BEST beds available in a hotel!!! Note to management...thanks for the free wireless, free water bottles and coffee machine. However, you need to put more electric outlets near the desk area in the rooms. Work-out room and sauna: two treadmills, two ellipticals, one bike. and cybex equipment. were all in good condition. Never crowded (at least in the early morning. I recommend to any business traveler in Downtown Baltimore. the walk to the inner harbor takes about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and affordability”
Reviews.Author: TMB625
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Plaza is the place to stay when visiting Baltimore. Not only are the rooms spacious and modern, but the staff is welcoming and very accommodating. From valet to front desk to housekeeping, the entire staff did everything in their power to make my stay top notch. Both the full service restaurant and deli provided an excellent selection and quality of food at reasonable prices. Add in the hotel's location in relation to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards and this hotel can't be topped.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable rooms, free wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a week-long meeting. The rooms are quite large and include kitchenettes. The wireless internet worked well and I appreciate it being included without an extra surcharge. The adjoining "Tremont Grand" former Masonic building is worth a tour if you have the chance. The self-parking lot next door is very convenient and less expensive than the valet parking by about $10 per night. Unless you'll be taking your car in and out a lot (it's a downtown neighborhood, so you probably don't have to) I would recommend it over the valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Best I found”
Reviews.Author: Leftsailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for beer week. The staff was always nice and helpful. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. The free shuttle (thanks James) was a real plus. The aquarium package gave me 4 free tickets to a great place to visit. Included was free valet parking! We did not know, they got our car, put it in the valet parking, brought it to us in am to check out with luggage, and left it valet until we left that night (after shuttle pick up) for no extra charge! The on site deli had a great breakfast at a very good price. Who could ask for more. Loved it and will be back. Thanks to all at the Plaza for your superior service. Well worth it. Charles Rue.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms & gorgeous beds”
Reviews.Author: LP29
Reviews.Content: Another great location to get to all attractions in Baltimore. If you're travelling with your family this hotel is perfect as the rooms are big! The beds are to die for ... The bed linen is so soft it's creamy. Great night's sleep. Breakfast is very reasonably priced too for a hotel and delicious too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: WIsil
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in downtown Baltimore, the hotel connects to one of the major hospitals. Very good rates, very large spacious rooms. Caters to families traveling for medical purposes. Good cafes, delis, menus for pre and post op patients. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE, ACCOMENDATIONS AND EMPLOYEES”
Reviews.Author: r s
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean The rooms were beautiful and appeared newly decorated.. The Bed was very comfortable. Any and all service requested was handled instantly, such as, extra towels etc.. The Deli was the best in any hotel, delicious with many selections and it stayed open late.The entire staff was polite, caring and amazing. The Doorman, Sean Deanes, CTA was very helpful and truly "aimed to please " showing great manners and a caring attitude. It was a 5 star experience all the way. I will stay at the Tremont Plaza from now on when I visit Baltimore. I would rate the hotel and the entire stay a 10 plus. R SMITH NYC, NY

Reviews.Title: “Tremont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Bonkysheek
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have been excellent if it wasn't for the loud noise from the water pipes. The staff is friendly and courteous. The room was impeccable and the bed to die for. I never have slept in such a comfortable bed. Not even in a sleep number bed. I would stay in this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Find”
Reviews.Author: RRingdahl
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Tremont by Johns Hopkins Medical Center and really had no expectations of what we would find. It turned into a wonderful stay, albeit short stay. The staff is extremely friendly, the rooms are very large, and the hotel dining was more that satisfactory. What topped the stay off was a tour of the Tremont Grand Conference Center -- an old Masonic Lodge that has been converted into a meeting center. This is truly an exceptional find in the middle of Baltimore. Highly recommend the Tremont, both for staying and as a location for meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Total Surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: serene4848
Reviews.Content: Just spent last week at a conference at Johns Hopkins University. We had a one day pre-conference at the Tremont. It was fantastic. The hotel has the grandeur of the beautiful hotels of last century. It has been renovated and kept up to standard. The room was very comfortable (King bed, living area and kitchen with microwave oven). Nicely decorated and all high quality fixtures in the bathroom. Flat screen TV's in the bedroom and living room. The conference room was unbelievable, the Edinburgh Room. Looks like something out of the middle ages but elegant. The other conference rooms were similar. They set us up with a beautiful room one night for a reception of about 50 people. A tour of the hotel (a former Masonic Temple) was very interesting: thanks Alexis. There must be about 30 floors. I was on the 15th and the view was nice. Elevators were always available and seemed fast. The Deli attached to the reception area is worth mentioning. It is something out of the mid 90's. Very well done and nothing junkie. The ladies working there are tremendous and seem more like old neighbors than workers. Talkative and kind. The one I seemed to bump into the most has been there for over 30 years. The food and baked goods are made on site. (meatball sub was so good I had it a second time!) I didn't use the gym but probably should have. Location is convenient. 10 to 15 minute walk to the Inner Harbor, about the same to get to Camden Yard and the Orioles games. Cost us about 18 dollars for a game. More to eat there but the sandwiches in the ball park were humongous. Valet parking is $25 a day so be aware of that. It may be cheaper to park elsewhere but it is very convenient. Many restaurants in the area as well as shops. What really put this facility over the top is the pride and service that the entire staff displayed the entire time i was there. I've been to the Ritz and it's comparable. Not as fancy, but the pride factor is right there. I wouldn't stay anyplace other than this hotel the next time I'm in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan999
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise - a bit of the old and the new. The front portion of the hotel is the hotel, the back portion is an old Masonic Temple. You need to check it out. A good experience overall. Food was good, rooms were good. Only issue was cost of valet parking...other than that a good experience. Never knew it was there...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeLynn3
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Tremont. Staff was over the top helpful and friendly, even running down the block to find us a taxi when the shuttle was full of fans getting to the Orioles game. Shuttle is always free and (under normal conditions) quick and easy to use. They will drop you wherever you request and pick you up at your request. A short 10 minute walk to Inner Harbor with plenty of delis and other shops on the block. Outdoor pool was an added treat as was the deli and restaurant in the hotel. Rooms are clean, housekeeping very prompt and all staff are very informed on the area. Would highly recommend. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay even with Earthquake and Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: mas4467
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in downtown Baltimore on business or pleasure. Great internet rate,wonderful service from valet, shuttle service to anywhere from the hotel, fast and easy. Earthquake of 5.9 hit the area and hurricane Irene came thru all on the same stay at the hotel. Everything was clean, maid service is one of the best. Resterant was open in the middle of the hurricane and the food was fresh, good and the service was really good for all that was going on outside. Linens were really soft as well as fresh towels in the bathroom. Work space was ample. Everyone tried to please you in some many areas of hotel service. Nice deli on the ground level for any food needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pmain13
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop on a road trip that included visits to Washington, DC and New York City as well as some other places. Since I was travelling alone with two kids (10 and 4), it was important to feel safe, save money, and get around to see sights easily. The Tremont was perfect for all these things. I found on their website a deal that included valet parking, a free drink each evening, and $15 credit each day in the deli. When we arrived, we had a little difficulty locating the hotel, but we were given directions by someone around the corner. We were welcomed by the valet and the front desk staff; both were very friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 21st floor, and we found it to be quiet, comfortable (each bed had 9 pillows!), and very clean. The kitchenette (with a fridge, toaster, sink, glassware, and utensils) was very convenient, and the complimentary bottled water was a nice touch. The dressing area with an oversized safe was nice. I had no problems accessing the Internet from our room. The sitting area was comfortable. The bathroom was a little small but comfortable enough, and the freebies were nice. The housekeeping staff was friendly. She even remembered my daughter's stuffed monkey's name and greeted her the next day. With the $15 credit, I was able to get dinner for the three of us from the deli the first night (with a little left over for milk to keep in the fridge). The deli has a good selection of items, including microwave dinners, snacks, wine, sodas, salads, pastries, candy, and lots more. On our full day in Baltimore, we went downstairs to find the shuttle driver ready and eager to take us to the Inner Harbor. The aquarium was celebrating their 30th anniversary, so there were lots of things going in the Inner Harbor. When we were finished exploring, we called the hotel and they sent the shuttle driver to pick us up. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant that night (to use my free drink vouchers). I had the grilled caesar salad and the crabcake appetizer for dinner. Both were fabulous and more than enough to make a meal. My kids had mini cheeseburgers. The bread was hard as a rock, so the cook sent out regular loaf bread cut in circles for buns. It worked well enough, although it was disappointing for them. On our second day, a really nice shuttle driver took us to Poe's grave and gave directions for walking back (at my request). It was an easy walk, and we felt safe. There are a lot of homeless people on the streets of Baltimore, but even as a woman travelling alone with children, I didn't feel threatened at any time. Checkout was easy. The staff member who checked us out was not as friendly as the others we encountered, but I assumed it was because she was busy. Before we left, I used the second $15 deli voucher to buy a large salad and snacks/fruit for the road, which was very convenient. Everyone in the deli was exceptionally friendly and eager to please the customers. We had a great stay at the Tremont and will definitely stay here again when we return to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasurable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. This Hotel deserves nothing but a 5 STAR. The Cleanliness, The helpful and courteous staff . Not one thing in this place could be found to be bad.I My Family and I enjoyed one of the most pleasurable stays in years. we have stayed at many places but this hotel is one that should be on everyones list. I can't believe some of the negative comments here. Apparently these people may be just one of those people you could never please. I am sure to return to this EXCELLENT hotel. And I highly recommend it to ALL. All the staff here are true professionals. All the services are top notch. I have never felt more welcome. I wish to convey my Gratitude and Thanks to all the staff in providing my family a place we could call home! Thank You again for providing the most memorable stay for my family in MANY YEARS! There are NO unpleasant surprises here. If you plan to tour this fine city and want to experience the most pleasurable time. STAY AT THIS HOTEL. You will not regret it. It is worth every penny. This place is the best kept secret in BALTIMORE!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room and hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruss533
Reviews.Content: We took our granddaughter to the aquarium in Baltimore and wanted to be close without paying the exorbitant prices of the hotels right on the inner harbor. We found this gem, I believe the only suites that are this close. Our room was quite large with 2 pillow top queen beds, a roomy living area with a flat screen TV, a closet/dressing area leading to the bathroom, and a kitchenette, complete with refrigerator, microwave, dishes, utensils. There is a lovely deli on the ground floor so we were able to purchase cereal and milk and fruit, have an early breakfast and set off to explore. Valet parking was $25 which was cheaper than others. Staff was friendly and accommodating, has answers to all my questions. My granddaughter loved the little splash pool outdoors. Hotel was clean and recently renovated. Did not use the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Most unhelpful staff ever. Of all time.”
Reviews.Author: rufustehshinra
Reviews.Content: The letter I just sent to them states it best, I think: "For the last five years I have brought a group of 8-10 people to Baltimore for Otakon. We usually stay for 3-5 days and always have a great time. This year we had the great misfortune of being saddled with your hotel. For the last four weeks in dealing with reservation issues and now with getting my cash deposit back, your staff have done nothing helpful. I have been given the run around, had charges mistakenly placed against my account, and have been a told a different thing each time I try to resolve an issue. I have been nothing but patient but I am beginning to get frustrated. Over Otakon we were in rooms [redacted] and room [redacted]. We only used the parking for one car - in room [redacted] . However, when I went to check out room [redacted] on Sunday, I was told I could not have my deposit back as somebody had used my cash deposit of $50 to pay for parking. This seemed like another bogus charge (much like the one of $168 that was placed against my debit card on Wednesday night when we arrived) as nobody in the room *had driven to Baltimore or owned a car*. I tried talking to Shanae about it and she said, "Sorry, there's nothing we can do." A follow up call on Monday night after we checked out of room [redacted] and were on our way home yielded similar results, along with refusal to let me speak to a manager. Finally, later in the week, Ermonate checked into it, said I would likely get my money back, and promised me a return call within 24 hours. No call came. No attempts to follow up have yielded results. I have been put on hold, transfered to offices that can't help (such as Sales or Security) and been denied all attempts to speak to management about this issue. One gentleman said he would have a manager call me back by six the next evening but of course, that never happened. Never before have I stayed in a hotel that has had such unprofessional and unhelpful staff. I am deeply upset by how I have been treated over the last month. We are letting all Otakon attendees know about the behavior of your staff and the disappointments involved in dealing with them. It should not take two weeks of constantly getting the run-around to resolve a simple issue over a deposit. I would like a call back from management as soon as possible to resolve this issue before I am forced to write in to traveler's magazines and the like to see if they can provide any assistance. I am tired of dealing with your staff and would just like this issue to be dealt with. I'm sure $50 seems like very little to a hotel that most likely does such great business, but it's a lot to me. That's my gas money for this month and making ends meet without it has been difficult." If you're looking for a hotel with helpful and knowledgeable staff, this is not the hotel for you! Don't expect any useful help, especially from Inari and Shanae.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tirpak_p
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Hotel in Balitmore was a wonderful place to stay. The staff, from the minute you exited your car were so friendly, helpful and professional. Front desk and door men/valets were knowledgeable, providing helpful tips for guests. The rooms were lovely, and spacious - even had an unexpected kitchenette, separate from the sleeping area. The large dressing room off of the bedroom (and the way to access the bathroom )was also a nice feature. The beds were so comfortable and had only the finest of linens. Despite the hotel being over 20 floors the was never a wait for the elevators because they were plenty. We utilized the little deli/cafe off of the lobby quite a bit. They carried everything you could want, from wine/beer to unique bagged snack food to wonderful breakfast foods and salads and sandwiches. The staff there were so friendly and plesant.. A five block walk to the inner harbor from the hotel, which was pleasant or easy acess to the free metro bus shuttle - maps in the lobby. One disappointment was the pool was unavailable because of some work being done on the building but we really did not miss it. There is a full service resturant within the hotel but with all the fine dining in Baltimore we did utilize this either.If you are planning a trip to Baltimore, I highly recommend the Tremont Plaza Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of nice while at Mercy Hospital.....”
Reviews.Author: ScrappinMomma
Reviews.Content: This was one of the BEST hotels I have stayed at. I literally had a one bedroom apt. to myself on the 24th floor. The room was CLEAN and even though there was construction going on right outside my window, I did not hear a thing. The bed was FANTASTIC... Nice and comfortable after a long day at the hospital. Each "Jr. Suite" comes with a mini kitchen.. Apt. size fridge, micro, sink, and enough dishes/utensils for 4 people. Huge walk-in closet with adjoining bath that has been updated... Pure comfort! Excellent internet connection... Usually have difficulties in most hotels... Not here...The store/deli on the first floor was convenient. Average prices for the area. Easy walk to EVERYTHING. Very safe neighborhood. Was able to go to/from Mrecy every night without batting an eye since so close! Grocery store right around the corner. New free transportation located right outside the door that will take you anywhere within the city. Free parking for those families that are staying due to medical issues with Mercy Hospital. Also great price deal too! Check out the hospital website for more info... Nice OUTDOOR pool on 4th floor and very large exercise center too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: dvdmgsr
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids and I stayed at the Tremont Plaza over a Saturday, with the National Aquarium being the main attraction for the trip. We drove in late afternoon, and had a pleasant and easy check-in. The room was a very nice, large suite. Really, more like an actual apartment than most of the suite rooms one gets nowadays. A small bedroom, bathroom, decent sized living room with an actual dining area, and a reasonably sized kitchen. The kitchen had a small fridge, reasonable selection of utensils and dishes. The room was clean and nicely furnished, with a fold out bed in the living room that was quite comforable. Very nice, comfortable bed in the bedroom. The wireless internet was free, and worked quite well. Adjacent to the lobby is a convenience store that sells a lot of the usual things, but also had some nice looking pastries and cakes, and a reasonable selection of beer and wine. Prices were room service like, however. Typically we would have stayed at one of the big chain suite hotels closer to the Inner Harbor, but they were either completely booked up or charging extremely high prices, so we went with the Tremont Plaza. The room and hotel were nice, but it was a bit further afield than I would like. The recommended Google Maps walk from the hotel to the Children's Museum took us right through the red light district -- that was a bit awkward! This was not the Tremont Plaza's fault, but it says something about staying in a more downtown location away from the Inner Harbor. The neighborhood wasn't that bad, even the red light district, but there were definitely some very seedy elements around. The aquarium was probably only a 15 minute walk away, but for a number of reasons we decided to check out early on Sunday morning, drive down to the aquarium and park, and then enter the aquarium when it opened at 9. The main motivation was being able to leave to go home directly from our time at the aquarium. It worked out well, and that early the crowds were not that bad. In summary, the room was considerably nicer than what you would get at one of the chain suite hotels closer to the Inner Harbor, and probably a bit cheaper, but next time I will probably try to book earlier and stay at one of the chain places. For me, the nicer room and price did not make up for the less than prime location.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel, comfortable beds and a wonderful in house deli!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laurelprocter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days, visiting our daughter's future grad school and hunting an apartment for her. Even though the hotel is under renovation, it still was the perfect place to stay, close to the Inner Harbor , terrific shopping and a free bus line. Plus the Tremont Plaza Deli housed there is a wonderful place to eat for breakfast, lunch or dinner....great selections and friendly staff. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatMedart
Reviews.Content: My national association just held their annual meeting at the Tremont. We are a smallish group under 400 but need exhibition space. The Tremont offers a unique combo of newly remodeled rooms connected to a beautifully restored treasure. The only minuses were that we had to split our banquet into two rooms and go to another for speakers. It also is a bit confusing with the floors being different numbers in the connected buildings. I also do like a larger entry/front desk that gives friends an opportunity to find each other.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Stayed here for our wedding night!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLaughLive2011
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding in April 2011 at the Tremont Grand which is attached to the Tremont Plaza Hotel. Most of our guests also stayed at the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel. The staff is very attentive and made our stay the best! I had all of my bridesmaids stay with me in a 2 bedroom suite the night before the wedding. It was plenty of room for us to get ready as well. My husband and I were originally going to stay in the 2 bedroom suite for our wedding night but we got upgraded to the Presidential Suite which was AWESOME! You wouldn't believe this room, it was humongous! We had all of our bridal party stop by before they checked out just to see how spectacular it was. But really all of the rooms are completely upgraded and renovated. Book your stay at the Tremont Plaza and I'm sure you will be pleased too!

Reviews.Title: “The Icing on the Cake of a Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MTNester1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont over the weekend to attend a family wedding being held at the Tremont Grand. As soon as we pulled up, we were greeted, in a professional yet friendly manner, our bags were placed on a cart, and we were led into the lobby for check-in. We arrived at 7 PM on Friday night, and were in our room within 15 minutes of arriving at the hotel. Very impressive, especially as there were two major family reunions, and one large wedding all staying at the hotel! We booked a one bedroom suite, with a queen bed, and found the room to be spacious, with a nice kitchenette. The room was clean, neat, and had everything we'd need. We did need to turn on the refrigerator, which was a bit inconvenient as we had brought a cooler of food/drinks to host family members the next day, but it cooled off within a couple of hours. In talking to one of the valets, we discovered that the Tremont was once apartments, that had been converted to a hotel quite a while back. It does show as each room is slightly different in configuration, but that just makes it more interesting! We ate at Tugs, the in house restaurant, and although a bit overpriced, the food and drink was good. We also ate at the Deli, and their sandwiches were very good as well. The hotel is about a half mile uphill from the Inner Harbor, but it's a nice walk, although I wouldn't do it late at night....get a cab. Overall, a great stay, and I would highly recommend for this type of function! Note - Parking is valet only at a cost of about 25/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KP20175
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont during a very stressful couple of days. My son was undergoing spinal surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital which is very close. We arrived at the hotel the day of the surgery. The doorman (Sean) greeted us and asked what brought us to Baltimore. After telling him why we were there, Sean informed us that he was there to help us. He went out of his way to remove any stress and walked us to the front desk. At the front desk the people checking us in were also very understanding and out going. Everyone seemed to be trained on how to support and help families going thru the same situation as us. I also wanted to mention Matt who I think is the building electrican. He could not have been any kinder and went out of his way to help us. Besides the great service, the hotel is one of the old fashion hotels with a lot of character. It was undergoing renovations but was still in great shape. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are going to Hopkins. There is also a great little deli downstairs and really good cafe on the rear side for the hotel. The rooms are large and clean. The only downside was the pool was not open yet even though it was late June and 90+ degrees outside.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL~ FRIENDLY STAFF~ COMFY~”
Reviews.Author: mommasu25
Reviews.Content: WOW~ The Tremont Plaza Hotel was more than we expected~ I checked the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking, and they were all good, if not great so we decided to give it a try. We were treated like royalty. Everyone in the hotel treats thier guests as a part of thier family. We were so impressed, and delighted~ The rooms are beautiful, clean, comfortable, and all new linens, plenty of pillows, too~ Our doorman Sean mentioned that the hotel has recently been undergoing renovations, and the bathrooms are next to be redone. The bathroom was fine, I imagine it will be quite remarkable after the renovation. **Elevators were the fastest we have ever experienced in a hotel**

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: july099
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 35th floor 7/9/11. Attended Maze concert 'on the harbor'. Tremont staff was very professional/friendly. Valet attendants (Sean & Jigby) were outstanding; recommend this hotel. Valet park & catch Charm City (purple line) to get around!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tremont!”
Reviews.Author: cll45
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff make this hotel great. In addition, the rooms are large and very nice and the hotel location is perfect for easy access to downtown and the waterfront. I always stay at the Tremont when I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a last-minute trip.”
Reviews.Author: iluvbluwatr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book a last-minute trip to Baltimore using Expedia's unpublished rates. Once we booked, we saw we were staying here for less than $90 a night. Definitely a savings from their published rates! Pros: *The view from our 31st floor window. *All of the doormen. Very courteous and helpful. *The deli on the lobby floor for breakfast sandwiches. Amazing! *All the rooms are suites with a kitchen. *BEST sheets I have ever slept on! Bed was pretty comfortable too. *Room was clean. *Courtesy shuttle. FREE but you should tip the driver. *Staff was friendly. Cons: *Pool was closed for construction with no date for re-opening posted. *Front desk staff nice, but not overly helpful. We asked for advice on places to go and without a word were handed just a pamphlet to a fire engine museum. *No book/binder in the room describing where to find things in the hotel, menus for hotel restaurants, phone extensions to call, etc. I always use this binder in hotels and missed it here. Front desk staff was very confused when I asked about this. *No pen or paper in the room! Again- something I always use. *Checkout took 20 minutes. No waiting in line- they blamed the computer. Overall, I would say this is just an average hotel. We will not be back, but this is because we do not like to stay in the same hotel twice. Don't rely on this hotel to help you plan your trip. Concierge is almost non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie553
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Recently renovated, we were pleasantly surprised by the room size-all rooms are suites and have mini kitchens, sofa beds and the bed/linens were very comfy. The staff was helpful and friendly-it was our first visit to Baltimore and they gave us a room on one of the top floors overlooking the city. Extremely clean-nice big bathroom as well. Overall I thought the Tremont was great. You can park next door at a City lot for $15/day vs. valet at $25. The hotel is about 6 blocks from Inner Harbor, but the walk was fine. Staff even provides a shuttle service to area restaraunts at no charge. I loved staying at a smaller hotel and this one was fantastic-highly reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDavePhilly
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't be more friendly. The price couldn't be better. My only complaint was there were too many pillows on the huge bed....haha. We got a package that included a free drink each night at Tug's bar and grill, $15 vouchers at the deli and free valet parking($25 value) We opted for the king room. You could get lost in there. Had a fridge for my beer. You are a 10 minute walk to the aquarium, 15 to federal hill or fell's point restaurants and bars or a $10 with tip cab ride. Close to the ballpark too. Very clean. Look online for specials. Free internet is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: redrocktrekker13
Reviews.Content: The suite was beautiful, spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel is on the free Purple Bus route, making it easy to get around the city. My stay at the Tremont Plaza made the trip to Baltimore not only a pleasure but also a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great!”
Reviews.Author: tbent
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Tremont Plaza and our stay was excellent. Jamal and Angela who I believe are managers were great. As a matter of fact, everyone I encountered from the doormen, who were so friendly and helpful, to the front desk people to the cleaning crew were very nice. Not knowing much about the city, Jamal took the time to explain where everything was located, how to get there and how to get back! The staff also helped me out with some emergency dry cleaning (which was incredibly affordable) and herbal tea that seems to not so common outside of NYC. All in all, I would look forward to staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms and a Historic Past”
Reviews.Author: djsabra
Reviews.Content: I really liked the large suites that the Tremont has to offer and there are only 10 rooms per floor - so no matter where your room was located on the floor - it was not a far walk. The rooms have been updated and bed is unbelievably comfortable...the bathrooms have been redone and I have been told that they are going to refinish the tiling in each of the bathrooms - which will be very nice as the bath shower area is a fibreglass insert. I did see the updated bathroom in another room and they will be lovely once they are finished. The restaurant, Tugs had really very good food, but the service was lacking. There was not that many people and it took a long time to get lunch or even sweetner for our iced teas....I think once they tighten up on the restaurant service they will have a winning place to eat at. The front desk staff was very accomodating and very helpful. They were able to point me in the right direction for an offsite dinner and their recommendation was on-target. The area that this is in is definately "downtown" and I did have an issue with a panhandler that was particularly "persistent" and the bell staff took care of after it was made mention of it to them. The meeting rooms are really beautiful and historic - the only downside (which is really not much of a problem - depending on your group) that you have to walk to a different building via a hallway on the 5th floor. Although they had quite a bit of sinage I found the layout a little confusing...but there was plenty of staff to point you in the right direction. I enjoyed my stay at the Tremont and I will definately stay there again next time I am visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Car tampered with, Unprofessional Security/Manager, & Theft”
Reviews.Author: Wendy_1960
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from May 1-26th to attend training for my new position at work. I won't waste time reviewing the room, amenities, etc., since my reason for this review falls under "OTHER". #1. I used the hotel's valet parking during my stay. There were days at a time that I didn't use my car because transportation was provided to and from class. One particular day I did get my car and found that the shade to my panaramic roof was broken. I NEVER had this problem, and the shade was stuck in a position that I didn't leave it in. Apparently, the employee that parked my car decided to explore. He didn't realize that the shade works by remote, not by pulling. Anyway, I reported this to the "manager", and was told, "we only hire honest and professional employees". Needless to say, I was insulted. I was then interrogated by the "head of security", who proceeded to tell me how many fancy cars HE has. He also found it necessary to inform me of other "luxury" cars that come through? Please Note: I informed the staff that I was not seeking any damages. My car is under warranty and I was certain that I wouldn't be charged to have it repaired. I was able to speak to another manager who spoke to me in a more appropriate and professional way. #2. After departing for home, I noticed that my radio sounded a bit harsh. After going into my audio settings I noticed that my base volume was turned to 10+ (I had everything set to the middle setting). This may not sound like much of any issue, however, it was more confirmation that someone was having a great time exploring and experimenting in MY personal vehicle. I called and left a message for the manager since I felt strongly that she should revisit speaking with the staff. To date, I've never even received a call back. #3. During the remainder of my stay, some of the staff, including the first manager that I spoke with, was very smug to me. I felt as if I'd done something wrong by reporting what happened. It's not like I was asking for any compensation. #4. Another trainee reported her necklace stolen from her nightstand drawer during our stay. I don't know the outcome to date, however, as of the time we departed, nothing had been done. I am a regular on Trip Advisor and I plan many of my vacations, business trips, etc., based on reviews, good and bad. Besides fluffy mattresses, good food, indoor pools, etc., being treated with professonalism and respect is extremely important to me. Also, I think it's a shame that untrained, unprofessional, and untrustworthy employees, can make an otherwise nice place, a place of NO RETURN. What I endured was unacceptable and I hope there's improvement in the staff going forward. PS: There were several really nice employees like Damian, Lakia (restaurant), and the bartender (sorry I forgot his name). Nevertheless, my unfortunate experience is not one to overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, comfort and service from days gone by.....at the Tremont Plaza.”
Reviews.Author: SGreen66
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Plaza Hotel, Baltimore, MD is by far one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure to stay. A successful business trip that was enhanced by the many beautiful rooms used for our function, excellent service and great food. Customer service is a top rating factor for me and this hotel staff has it down to a fine art. Each and every staff member I encountered throughout my visit was pleasant, informative and helpful. The front desk personnel are to be commended for their service. .

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattybaker1
Reviews.Content: pull up outside and you are immediately waited on. Check is was quick and smooth. EVERYONE was friendly. Privately owned hotel and you feel part of the family the moment you step onto the property. The details in making you feel comfortable are endless. Ate at the Tugs Bar and Grille on the property. the food and service were excellent. Rooms were clean, fresh to the sight and smell, decorated nicely. Mattresses, pillows, duvets were comfortable. NO complaints. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “thanks tremont plaza hotel for GREAT SERVICE and a WONDERFUL STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: superducky6705
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent! Our family had medical needs at Johns Hopkins Hospital- the hotel offers a shuttle that takes you there FREE OF CHARGE and are sensitive every need of their quests. The rooms are comfortable, the personnel are professional and courteous- we highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!!! We especially enjoyed the service of matthew the bellman! -Johnson Family

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dpraise1
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the most friendly people working there and they have the best deli awesome sandwiches I think it was fifty to be exact and the rooms where so spacious and comfortable I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: beckepg
Reviews.Content: Great people, location, and beds. Clean and good condition throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great sheets!”
Reviews.Author: lifebooker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple friends and we all agreed that the sheets and bed were very comfortable (even the pullout couch bed). Had a minor issue with the fire alarm chirping when we arrived because it was low on batteries, but a friendly maintenance staff member came to fix it right away. Front desk and door staff were very friendly and courteous. Also got a good workout at the gym which had a pretty good variety of functional equipment (bands, bosu balls, etc) that you don't normally see at other hotel gyms. The gym also had a small studio with a video system set up for yoga and cardio classes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional! Top to bottm world class service provided here!”
Reviews.Author: VictoryRider
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a wedding at the adjacent Tremont Grand and stayed in the hotel. We were delighted with the service, from the valet attendant to the front desk and everyone we encountered. Never in all of our travels have we enjoyed a hotel stay as much. FIVE stars for terrific service and beautiful accomodations. Also, if you need to plan an event choose the Tremont Grand...this was the BEST wedding we've ever attended. Food was amazing and we wish we received such caring service everywere.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: aew02
Reviews.Content: The best part of my stay was the valet guy, Matthew Morin, that met me when I first arrived. I had gotten off track on the trip and ended up somewhere in town I probably should not have been. I pulled up to the hotel in relief, he greeted me and could see on my face that I was stressed. He told me not to worry because I had made it. He took care of my parking and my bags. After I arrived I realized I had grabbed the wrong charger for my phone. I was running back and forth from the hotel to the parking garage to charge my phone. I saw Matthew on one of those trips, told him what I was doing and he told me to wait that the hotel has a bag of chargers. He helped me go through the bag until we thought we found a match, but to no avail. I thanked him for his efforts and walked to my car for my phone. By the time I returned to my room he was on the phone to tell me he found the pieces I needed. I appreciate everything he did to help me out. He went above and beyond and it should not go unnoticed. I work for Citi and was in town for training and Matthew Morin made my trip excellent. Thank you Matthew!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but good for the value”
Reviews.Author: laidbackdude2011
Reviews.Content: I'm torn. a few negatives but good for the value. got a great online deal. Pros: suites. huge space. if you're traveling with a group of people (between the bedroom and open living room) you can easily fit 6-8 people. Negative: hot water in shower took 15 minutes to become hot, not a very comfortable space (but a comfortable bed), construction work noise, plumbing issues, staff were not very refined (but you can tell they are trained to provide customer service but set in. For instance, you can say "sir" and "thank you" a thousand times, but customer service is also about the actions), the shuttle takes 15-20 minutes for pick up, Its in a good location, but if you go 7 blocks near the Conventon Center there are more hotels, and in that area more restaurants. Since I had meetings near the convention center, I would have stayed in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: lschmitty
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Tremont Plaza Hotel. I traveled with my husband, and our 3 children, ages 15, 6 and 4. This was one of the few hotels that I could find downtown that would accommodate 5 people in one room, AND provided queen beds instead of doubles. Check-in had a long line due to a wedding that night, but it moved very quickly, and the employee at the desk was efficient and polite. We got a room on the 30th floor with 2 queens, and our requested rollaway was at the door within minutes. We had a lovely view of the city, and we were very happy to discover that the windows actually opened. This was especially helpful since the room was VERY warm despite turning the thermostat all the way down. The kitchenette was a nice surprise. Bedding was some of the nicest I've slept on, and the down pillows were excellent. All the furniture seemed to be new, and the swiveling flat screen TV was a hit with our kids. We only encountered a few problems (in addition to the room temperature). The rollaway bed that we requested (for an additional $20 per night) came with only a bottom sheet, which was stained. When we opened up the blanket folded in the closet, crumbs spilled out along with a white pill! We called to have it and the stained sheet replaced, and housekeeping took care of it quickly. Another small problem was because of the VERY thin walls. I was awakened at 3:00 am by the extremely rude and obnoxious sorority girls in the room next door to us. They must have been in their kitchen, because it literally sonded like they were right in ours. I'm not sure why the hotel would place a family with 3 children (2 of them quite young) next to a group of partying teenagers. If we had been staying for more than 1 night, I would have asked to be moved. My last complaint has to do with Tugs Bar and Grill. We went for breakfast on Sunday, and it seemed like the staff had all been hired the day before. Everyone was very nice, but nobody knew what they were doing. The waitress gave my 3 and 6 year old water in a glass goblet, and when we asked for a child cup, we received DOF glasses from the bar! We finally got a bus boy to get us a cardboard cup with a lid...probably from the convenience store. My husband's eggs benedict came without the advertised asparagus, and my son's over easy eggs were cooked solid. Overall, I was pleased with our stay and what we paid. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The proximity to the harbor and all the attractions is great, and the $5 self parking was very convenient. I would definitely stay here again, but would skip Tugs, check the sheets and hope for a quieter neighbor!

Reviews.Title: “Should have selected the other chain hotel for our wedding guest weekend”
Reviews.Author: mollypuddy
Reviews.Content: Our hosts offered two hotel choices for weekend accomodations for their wedding; I wish we'd taken the large hotel chain choice instead of this one. I'd call this hotel barely renovated. While the staff was exceptionally polite and friendly, our room was unclean and suffered several maintenance issues. The carpet was very dirty; drapes dated; kitchen sink area in the suite unclean; medium-size flying insect smashed and dried on bathroom floor that I was unable to remove, also urine stains on floor; room safe was locked and required engineer reset; bathroom sink was clogged and required snaking; heating/cooling unit stopped working mid-second night; husband slipped in bathtub due to lack of non-skid surface; maid didn't approach our room until 3pm our second day- she offered to clean it then but we had to decline as we needed to dress for the wedding. Lastly, another guest's used room service tray remained on the floor in the hallway in front of the elevators for about 24 hours. On the plus side, my husband liked the fitness center and the on-premises deli was excellent. The beds were comfortable, too. The staff was very accomodating when we relayed our complaints at checkout. However, would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: true2me2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with family members and loved it! Our room was on the newly renovated 26th floor. The room was nicely decorated with modern furnishings, granite counter tops in kitchenette, nice clean carpet, and a great city view. Also, the bed was very comfortable and the entire suite was very spacious. Had dinner at Tugs, thought the crab cakes were delicious. Valet parked the car which was the best option for parking. Staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel does have a historic feel and certain areas just look outdated but they seem to be working on modernizing the decor and/or renovating throughout. Convenient location, close to harbor and Johns Hopkins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DELAWHERE58
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Tremont Plaza was very friendly and helpful at all times. Even in the elevator a secretary at the hotel wanted to know how our stay was and if there were any questions or anything that we needed. Everyone friendly and nice from the doorman, frontdesk, bellman, and the wonderful people in the Deli. We took our ice bucket with us to the Deli to check out food and figure on the way back up to our room we would get ice for it. The Deli staffers asked if they could fill our ice bucket, they said why make another stop when they have ice and can help us. People thinking ahead and trying to make the guests feel welcome. Rooms were clean and nice, updates are great that have been made to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was friendly, however our bedding was unacceptable.”
Reviews.Author: jskillz420
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we immediately noticed dust and hair in the bathroom. THEN FOUND HAIR IN THE BED! One pillow even had yellow stains on it. We almost turned around and left but my wife insisted that she would make our bed given clean linens to avoid further hassle.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: hominamad
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand any of the positive reviews listed on this and other sites. This hotel was one of the most deceptive marketed hotels I've stayed at. The hotel was absolutely nothing like the website photos depicts it. Apparently this hotel is connected to a conference space which is supposedly a beautiful historic building. I never got to see it because that building was locked up when I stayed there because there were no events going on that day. You enter the tiny lobby from an entrance in the back which is barely marked. There is a tiny little area to pull your car up to unload, then you have a choice of paying $25 for valet parking, or going around the corner and parking your car yourself for $5-$15 per night. I don't stay at hotels for the lobby, but the rooms had much to be desired. The layout was terrible, everything was dirty, the towels were stained and the bathroom was gross. This was the first hotel I've stayed at where the bathroom was so disgusting that I actually couldn't even shower in it. On the weekend, almost everything around the hotel was closed. Luckily I only stayed there one night. I never really write reviews of hotels, but I wanted to write this one to warn people against the deceptive marketing photos, and the unexplainable good reviews around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: DHSalazar
Reviews.Content: 1.  Located about 3 miles from John Hopkins Hospital.  2.  Accessible Jr. Suite was comfortable. Roll-in shower. Easy to maneuver in wheelchair. It has 2 queen size beds - I would recommend 1 bed. Kitchette is a great addition-microwave, frig, toaster, sink, dishes etc. Small table.  3.  Staff - extremely pleasant to deal with. Very very friendly & helpful.  4.  You can see the holes in the ceiling of the bathroom where the renovations were done. It is an older hotel but has and continues to be renovated. That was the major complaint we had...you could hear them drilling at 9am in the morning.  5.  The restaurant did not have a large selection of items. There is a deli on the premises which does have a great selection of sandwiches, prepared foods, etc.  6.  Overall, not a bad hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise package at the Tremont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: NuclearRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before a Royal Caribbean 9 night leaving from Baltimore. Package ($225 including taxes) allowed us to leave the car in valet parking for the duration of the cruise. Also included a $25 voucher for food. We used ours for breakfast, but it is also good at the deli off the lobby. It would have been $150 just to leave the car at the pier. The hotel gives taxi vouchers for the trip to and from the pier (tip not included). They also have a complimentary shuttle van to take guests to local attractions. Very nice upscale hotel about 5 blocks from the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “most wonderful and great value”
Reviews.Author: DonHill58
Reviews.Content: In a time of stress your staff gave me a feeling comfort and secure. My wife in the hospital and needing understanding your staff was there to help. You suttled me back and forth to the hospitals front door. Thanks and God Bless you in a special way.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Freq_Travelr_11
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and this was my first time to Baltimore. The staff made me feel so special during my stay and the rooms are nice, cozy suites with beautiful views of the city! Every employee that I came in contact with took a personal interest in ensuring that my stay was the best that I had ever experienced. My colleague and I have coined this hotel "The Best Hotel on Earth."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: LMac84
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for business that included a conference that was held at the Tremont Grand (attached to the hotel). The staff greeted us at the door and the check in process was smooth. The hotel is a former apartment building so the rooms are very large. I had an end unit that included a large room with queen beds, kitchenette, and a large walk in closet. The room (bathroom included) was very clean. The hotel has 37 floors so there are 4 elevators to accomodate. I did not turn on my tv and I was traveling alone so I was able to hear some elevator noise but I think most people would not even notice. The only strange thing was that the room was missing a clock. I use my phone for this purpose so I was ok. I did request wake up calls which occurred without mishap. The hair dryer did not work and when I called the front desk they were very quick to respond with a replacement hair dryer. I definately enjoyed my stay and it was a quick walk to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jakewaynesboro
Reviews.Content: My Husband had eye surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital, when I called the Tremont Plaza about a room, they took care of me right away, the room was nice and clean, all the staff couldn't have been nice and helpful, we has spent all day at the Hospital and were very tired, so we ordered dinner from room service, they put it on our table, it was hot, and was just perfect. Thank you so much for making a bad day lots better Joe & Nancy Adams

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: geronurse
Reviews.Content: I want to first give a whole hearted thank you to Joann, Jamal and Jen N. They each exemplify excellent customer service. I can't say enough about them. Their customer service in my family's time of need was outstanding. Now about the hotel. Great proximity to John's Hopkins Hospital with a shuttle. The room was very comfortable clean and very roomy, with a good location to a Walgreens and a grocery store 2 blocks away. My mom was in John's Hopkins my sister was there to stay with my mother and she ended up in a car accident and had to go to the hospital. I was in another state at the time so I had to arrange a place for my sister to stay while she recovered from her car accident and was close enough to see our mom. After a quick review of places from The John's Hopkins website and trip advisor I called Tremont and spoke with Joann and explained everything that was going on and that I needed a room for my sister asap. The next day I arrived in Baltimore and I was very pleased at the room condition, cleanliness and the size. This is a great place for patients and visitors of John's Hopkins to stay or even if you are just visiting Baltimore. My sister rested comfortably and safely and was able to visit John's Hopkins daily. I also want to say thank you to the lady bartender at the hotel my sister would talk to when she went to get some food and a drink, you were great as well. I can honestly say the stay would have been good but it was excellent simply because of the customer service given to us by Joann, Jamal, Jenn N and the bartender lady. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Value”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl1125 Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a short stay (1 night) but we enjoyed our visit to your hotel. The rooms were surprisingly large and comfortable. We had a great view of the city. The doorman Sean was extremely pleasant and helpful. He recommended a great restaurant for us to eat breakfast and was instrumental in providing transportation for us to get there. We would stay at the Tremont again also recommend others. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “HA! Nice view, hope you're an early riser”
Reviews.Author: winnowedsoul
Reviews.Content: I did give this hotel another try, after the last rewview I was sent a "free weekend night". The certificate for a single night after a 10 day /9 night stay was pretty much a joke. Now remember they are now remodeling EVERYTHING apparently The facade in front of our room was being jack hammered at exactally 8:30AM after a Halloween stay and that was certainly not welcomed. If I had not known there were not people IN my room I would have had no idea. The event they were hosting was attarcting a rather rough crowd and yet again you had to battle the staff to get an elevator becasue apparently they are more important than a guest. The new decor was certainly needed however a facelift doesn't make a hotel a better place, just a better looking place but all the same folks still work there with the same "who are you to want something, I know better because I work here" attitude.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER @ THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: pretty_eish
Reviews.Content: Yes that’s my title because that’s exactly what occurred once I entered my room..I’m a frequent visitor at this property and by, was I displeased! The quality of the room was far less than I experienced on any other visit, and to think I had an updated renovated room. I made a 2 night reservation and wound up leaving after the 1st night..By far this was the worst time and money spent at this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: cruiselover065
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont Plaza because it was recommended by someone at John Hopkins Hospital, and it was a wonderful recommendation. Every single employee that we encountered was very friendly and helpful-the valet service, the check in process, the restaurant, the deli-the shuttle service to and from the hospital. The rooms were spacious and very clean and comfortable Great choice of hotel if you are traveling to Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: ComplexCarb
Reviews.Content: I don't know when was the last time I encountered such a warm, helpful hotel staff. They made our one-night stay a total pleasure. Between the front desk, room service, porters, and valets, everyone we dealt with was pleasant, polite, helpful, and genuinely concerned with our well-being. Our renovated room was attractive, and the front desk advised us about ongoing work on other floors and to inform the staff if it became an issue. It never did. The food we had delivered from the hotel restaurant was outstanding -- another pleasant surprise. The restaurant staff also was happy to custom-make a kid-friendly meal for my daughter, and she devoured every bite. We will definitely return to the Tremont Plaza Hotel. It was so refreshing to encounter this high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: lizpapachristou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not new, but the rooms are recently renovated with good taste, most of them have a nice view and they also have a little very convenient kitchen with fridge. The hotel is located near the city's inner harbor where all the shops and the restaurants are - do you want more? The staff is efficient and friendly, the doorman knows the locals restaurants like his own kitchen and there is a business center open 24/7, where I was able to do my airline check-in and print it for free!!! They also have interesting offers on their web site quite often. If that's not excellent value for money, I don't know what is!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: CapitalMom
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference. The hotel is shabby. My room was very large but lacked any furniture. There were 2 beds and a small table with chairs but no arm chair or love seat. This was odd because the room was so spacious and there was a lot of empty space. The toilet did not flush properly. The shower dripped and the tub had water stains. There was no really hot water, just luke warm. The carpet was stained and worn. I think they are renovating and no doubt all of this will improve. The breakfast restaurant was reasonable and the service was good. However, on Sunday they open at 7am but when I arrived at 7:15 they were not set up and the door was locked. I wondered if they rarely have much business. There were many participants from my conference hoping to have breakfast before the day began and it was a wait for them to finally open. The check in and out was quick and easy and the front desk staff were pleasant. This has the feel of a place that could be really nice after it is renovated. I wouldn't pick this hotel at this time however.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a friend's wedding in Baltimore. Since the wedding reception was at the nearby Tremont, the location was perfect. It is also located a quick 10 minute walk to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. The room was quite large and comfortable. The only drawback was the steep parking charge for the valet/garage, but it's expected in a city. Breakfast buffet in hotel restaurant was good with lots of hot and cold options.

Reviews.Title: “Had a real problem!”
Reviews.Author: sultana33
Reviews.Content: My family and I came into town for an event, it was only one night, and when we checked in, we thought the rooms were very nice. Soooooo after we came back from the event, we were up talking, laughing and looking at our pictures, when the unthinkable happened. There was a ROACH in our room, luckily some smart thinking men, hurried and captured the roach with a cup, and waited for staff to come up. We ended ip getting a new room. And was also compensated, but tossed and turned the entire night, and couldn't wait to leave the next day. Will not be staying here again. Can't help but think that roaches don't travel alone, there must be more in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kmrva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont because of its location next to Mercy Medical Center where I was for surgery.
