Having made reservations months in advance, I continued to check Tripadvisor reviews since they were so mixed. To say I was pleasantly surprised is an understatement. Many of the reviews made it sound like a dump. We requested a renovated room and we were on the 30ish floor. The views were fantastic, the room large and clean and there was no noise from adjoining rooms that you get in the newer hotels. The staff was probably some of the friendliest I have encountered at any hotel I have stayed in. We will be returning in December for another surgery, and you bet we will be staying there again. We also appreciated the special rates for Mercy Patients that are available. I takes some of the stress off of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is to be highly commended for their great service”
Reviews.Author: Baltimore_10
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Hotel staff is to be highly recommended for their service during our weekend stay. The rooms were clean, very comfortable and we had a great view of Baltimore. The food was well prepared and there was a variety of very tasty dishes. It was very nice to be greeted by the staff as you came down for breakfast with plenty of juices, rolls, fruit etc. and good strong coffee. The staff was very accomodating and very willing to help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: christycj17
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night. But it was a great room. We were in a remodled suite on the 35th floor. What great view. The front desk was very accomodating and the staff was very nice. We Had a little problem with the hot water,but the maintenance dept came right away to remedy. Th e only little draw back was it was a little distance from the harbour. But they do have shuttles to where you need to go. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family and Friends”
Reviews.Author: principaljacki
Reviews.Content: We recently attended my nieces wedding at this beautiful Hotel. Our stay was from Oct. 7-10. Our entire family attended coming from Boston, Seattle, New Jersey, New York, Virginia and Pittsburgh. Upon arrival the doorman greeted you with a big smile and began to help unload the car. The front desk was also extremely friendly. The rooms were all suites with generous space and comfortable accommodations. There is a Deli/Market with the most delicious sandwiches and breaskfast foods. The staff there was also very friendly. The price for the food was extremely reasonable for a large hotel. The restaurant, Tugs, was quite accommodating. The hotel is in walking distance to the Inner Harbour and historic sights such as the first basilica in the Unied States. We had a wonderful time especially being Steeler Fans in Raven's Territory.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, okay location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: redsox367
Reviews.Content: For the price paid I am sure there may be better options but none the less comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly, and the location is within 10 minutes walk off the harbour. Whilst the area felt generally safe I was wary at night returning to the hotel as the area quiet. Hotel is in need of some investment in the rooms which do feel that they are a 5-10 years out of date

Reviews.Title: “The Tremont Plaza Hotel was so very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: maryecox
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay at The Tremont Plaza. My 92 year old father was very thoughtfully put in the room next door. The elevators are fast! Front dest service was very helpful and we especially enjoyed the free shuttle to a wonderful downtown restaurant, Miss Shirleys. From the momemt we arrived to the moment we left we were extremely pleased with our stay. I recommend it and will stay there again. It is only four blocks from the Inner Harbor ~ and remember the free shuttle if you are too tired to walk back to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not well known - but should be”
Reviews.Author: SFBayBiz
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month we decided to get out of the suburbs for a weekend and spend a couple of days in Baltimore to attend a Wine and Jazz festival. While it's natural to gravitate toward the big chains we try to make a point of trying out some of the lesser known names. Sometimes it works out -- sometimes not, but in the case of the Tremont we were well rewarded. First of all, the Tremont is located in a safe part of the city -- there's a Caribou Coffee within walking distance and plenty of bars a restaurants as well. Our room was very clean and a little larger than what were expecting from a downtown hotel. Our best memory of the Tremont was a small thing that went a long way to showing the attentiveness of the staff. We were in town for the Canton Wine and Jazz Festival and didn't really have a good sense of navigating our way. One of the front desk personnel patiently gave us directions and then gave us his cell phone number! He asked us to give him a call if we got lost along the way. We made it with no problems but that was a very nice gesture! Don't know when we'll make our next weekend foray into Baltimore but I think we'll try the Tremont as well -- and we'd certainly recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Space, views, nice linens, etc., just don't expect early check-in”
Reviews.Author: PyrotechnicDaisy
Reviews.Content: No, it's not a fancy-smancy resort hotel. In fact, it is a very basic hotel but it does that really, really well. We were very comfortable and felt the weekend was a bargain at only $99 night for a HUGE room, which included a sitting area and separate kitchen. Yes, there was a stain on the carpet and the decor wasn't very current (although there seems to be a renovation underway, so perhaps this will change soon). However, the things that really count in a hotel were great: there were wonderful linens on the bed, a lots of nice towels in the bathroom, beautiful views out the window, an iron, hairdryer, and fridge, and it was BIG. My only complaint is that they were not very accommodating with an early check-in, which would have been nice since the wedding—which was our purpose for the visit and started at the same time as check-in-- was at the hotel. Despite my request when I made the reservation and calling an hour or two before arrival, we had to wait a while. Otherwise, it was great having the wedding reception in a BEAUTIFUL hall attached to the hotel. It was very nice to take the elevator the room after the reception, although we made a pit stop at the hotel restaurant, where a wonderful staff member named “Jamie” kept the bar open late for the wedding party to continue our revelry after the ballroom closed (and then he was up smiling and serving us brunch the next morning.) Overall, we found the accommodations very comfortable for the money and frankly, I didn’t really want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking all around”
Reviews.Author: cwm3
Reviews.Content: I recently had the privilege to spend 2 nights at the Tremont Plaza in Baltimore. I was in town with my girl friend to see a friend of ours walk down the proverbial aisle into wedded bliss. The large meeting room with the columns (I forget the name) was exquisite and so very appropriate for a reception. Beautifully decorated and at a perfect temp for the formal attire that weddings bring. The staff was friendly and responsive. The food was delicious - a smorgasbord with something for all tastes to enjoy. I look forward to returning there sometime soon, perhaps to stay in one of the luxurious suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sumwell
Reviews.Content: This place was in the perfect location to Camden Yards and the Harbor. The rroms were huge and very clean. Staff was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside, not so great on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Ybaez
Reviews.Content: The 2 nights we spent at the Tremont were probably the most uncomfortable nights I've had at a hotel. I'd like to start by saying that the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. We were suggested a few nearby restaurants that were great! But when we walked into our room, it smelled like spoiled eggs! It was discusting! We called downstairs and they sent up a new room key for a room down the hall. I think I would have rather stayed in the stinky room! This room had stains on the rug, broken chairs, ripped sheets, stained and discolored comforter, purple writing on the wall in the bathroom....need more? The shower had shelf or place for soap or shampoo or anything. There was no vent in the bathroom so the mirror fogged up and stayed that way for a while also, picture doing your business with nothing to vent out the odor. The water pressure in the shower was a joke! And I wish I had brought my own towels because theirs were scratchy. Oh, I wish I had pictures to prove all this, but I couldn't charge my camera because there were maybe 4 outlets and they were all used my the lamps in the room. Lastly, the housekeeping was mediocre at best. Our room had 2 queen size beds so my husband and I only occupied one of them. After a long day of touristing, we walked in the room and one bed was half made with 2 pillows just tossed on the bed. The rest of the pillows were just thrown on the second bed. Huh? To top it all off, the second night, the air conditioner decided it wanted to be a fan and just blow the yuckie humid air around the room. Fantastic! Over all, this hotel's outward appearance makes it seem like a swanky downtown kind-of upscale spot (check out the website). But really it's just like the quality inn down the street. Save yourself the money...stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Eltang66
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay where i traveled with my two young children. We got a special $99 rate for their studio suite and felt that was a really good value for the room. The studio suite was pretty large with 2 double size beds, a HUGE walk in closet that led to the very small, ventless bathroom. There was also a small kitchenette area that was enclosed. The walk in closet was larger than the kitchenette. The kitchenette had a small fridge (something was off with it because it froze all my drinks but still handy to have), a microwave, sink and coffee maker. There were also 2 sets of plates, bowls, mugs, glasses and silverware which were very convenient with the kids because we had our own breakfast in the room. Housekeeping cleaned the dirty dishes as part of their daily service. The bathroom was what i'd call serviceable. It was small, old and ventless and the towels were thin. My parents room's kitchenette was twice the size of mine (they were in room 2704 and i was in room 2707). So i think the 04 room line may be larger. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel. A full service one and a deli. The full service one (Tugs I think it was called) we went once for breakfast and did not return because the food was pretty lame. The deli wasn't that great either, but very convenient and reasonably priced if you want deli sandwiches. Overall customer service was good. They had several other functions there during my stay, so it seems pretty popular. Plus they are undergoing room renovations, which is needed because the carpeting was worn and stained in some spots and both the kitchen and baths need sprucing up. Although for $99/night, it was a good value and a decent stay. The self service parking garage next door was reasonable as well. We kept our car parked for the whole 4 days we were there. Didn't need it for the Inner Harbor touring we did. Lastly, it's a convenient place to stay if you're going to spend most of your time at the Inner Harbor area like we did. The free Purple Route bus shuttle stops right by the hotel and takes you to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet room, super service, Deli is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mfmsr
Reviews.Content: Superb location, service and cleanliness. Deli is terrific. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Kinch417
Reviews.Content: We live in nearby Bowie, MD and this was the first time I stayed at a hotel in Baltimore. We decided to stay overnight because we were attending the Otakon convention at the Balt. Convention Center (BCC). btw, Otakon is a convention for people who love Japan and the Japanese version of animation called ANIME. Good points: Friendly staff Relatively close walking distance to BCC On the free commuter circular (bus line) to BCC and inner harbor Very good gym and sauna on premises If you arrive early they will store your bags until your room is ready Mixed points A pool on premises - is complimentary but it's small and could probably only fit about 6 swimmers at one time. Also, it's located on the 4th floor to close to the street noise, which unfortunately includes lots of sirens The room - nice but old. Ours included a kitchenette. The toilet ran constantly and the shower was slow to drain. There were 2 doors between the bathroom and the sleeping area, so shutting both eliminated the noise. We were on the 24th floor and could still hear the sirens. I also thought the room needed another set of drawers as the was only one with 2 drawers. The beds were ok. Extras - The full breakfast is very good with generous portions, but not normally included with your stay; our price included 2 breakfasts per day. We paid $10 for our 3rd person which I guess is about average for Inner Harbor Baltimore. Valet parking is not normally included, but was in our price and the service was very good. The management has no problem in letting you know that if you don't want to pay for their parking, there is public parking available at a much lower rate and right next to the hotel. There's also a free shuttle available with first priority given to those guests who are either patients or relatives of patients of Johns Hopkins Hospital. I think they had in-room computer access, we saw a box of some kind and could only guess that it was for laptops since we didn't bring ours. The Bad: Housekeeping was slow to respond (an hour after our 1st request) and our towels weren't changed. We called about the running toilet immediately and again after we returned and it was never addressed. Since shutting the doors eliminated the noise we didn't call again. In the end: I would recommend this hotel on a conditional basis depending on what the person wants in a hotel room. Since it's the only hotel I've been to in Baltimore I can only compare it to other hotels I've been to, which may not be fair to other Baltimore hotels. It's certainly not the worst place I've been to. However, we've already booked a different hotel for next year's convention.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service and staff - accommodated me very well.”
Reviews.Author: keitheo
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly, more so than 90 percent of the hotels I stay at for business. Great location and conference rooms. The elevators are a little slow though. Keith

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suite, attentive staff - we really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Maffles
Reviews.Content: For my annual business conference, my husband and I enjoyed a 4-night stay in a spacious, updated suite with a full kitchen and a very comfy bed. The suite was clean and quiet and did I say, spacious. All of the staff--room service, front desk, at Tug's restaurant and especially the Deli were friendly and very customer service-oriented. It was warm in Baltimore, yet the room temp was just right. Just a little frustrated that one of the treadmills and a television was not working in the exercise room. A big plus was the meeting rooms for the conference. This hotel is connected to a former historic temple--our meeting rooms were beautiful--architecture, wood work, art work, exquisite carpeting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cll45
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent - every person I encountered working at the hotel was friendly and helpful. My room was large with a very comfortable bed and small kitchenette (half-size refrigerator, microwave, dishes). There was a sitting area with a sofa, TV, chairs, and desk. I will definately stay at the Tremont Plaza again when I next visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleFrogLady
Reviews.Content: VERY large room, more like an efficiency apartment. Very comfortable bed, with turned down sheets every evening. The housekeeper would do cute things with my daughter's panda every day that made her laugh when we returned back there each evening. There's a small kitchenette with a half-size refrigerator, microwave, dishes, etc. There's a sitting area with a sofa, chairs, and desk. It's very spacious compared to most hotels, including other suite-type rooms. The bathroom was very good with a large walk-in closet. The service was very good all-around. It was quiet and very comfortable. The parking is expensive and not very convenient, if you don't want to pay for valet parking. It's in a building about a half a block away. We came to Baltimore to look at a college for my daughter, and now that she's enrolling there, we are planning to stay there again when we take her to begin college in August and on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly.”
Reviews.Author: bigdog717
Reviews.Content: The Good~room was larger than expected, free internet in room. The Bad~one of the queen beds was like sleeping on a roller coaster, apparently the frame was loose and every time you moved the whole bed did too. Carpet was stained. Bathtub drained very slow. T.V. ~ poor choice of channels and reception was bad. No exhaust fan in bathroom. Housekeeping sprinkled carpet fresh around the room but forgot to vacuum it up. The whole room smelled like a funeral parlor. The Ugly~I forgot my camera in the Tugs Resaurant at the table. I went back to look for it but it mysteriously disappeared. By the way there was only one other couple there, seated at the far end of the room and only one waitress. I called the next day and got the run around from everyone. I requested to speak to a manager and was told that since it was a holiday weekend no manager was on duty. I made another call the following day and requested to speak to a manager, got connected to voice mail and have yet (five hours later) to receive a return call.

Reviews.Title: “Earned a Stamp of Approval - signed Very Picky”
Reviews.Author: PickyVactioneer
Reviews.Content: Please know there is also a Tremont Grand, where the initial pictures on their website. Overall, I must say, as a picky hotel/resort go-er, I gave the stamp of approval. I booked 2 rooms (both w/2 beds) due to traveling with 4 kids and 3 adults. When we arrived, I met Erica (wonderful! wonderful! wonderful!) who was the reservationist. I asked if we could get adjoining rooms, since we were arriving at the top of the check-in hour. She advised they did not have adjoing rooms, but offered 2 rooms on the same floor. In agreeing, she managed to find to rooms that were adjacent. The hotel's lobby is small but clean and updated. The bellmen get the door for you or you can use the rotating door to enter. There are 4 elevators, kind of narrow, a restaurant and bar on site (decent food & good drinks), a pool and exercise room are on the 4th floor, and vending/laundry machines are on 2nd floor. If I had to be picky, I would say the carpet in the room and couch could be "updated". Otherwise, the kitchen area (in a 1 Bedroom suite - we upgraded one room w/a king and pullout sofa) was nice, the bathroom was ok (tub could be "udpdated"), sink were nice, and bed was fine. Our two rooms bed linen were white, as you see in the pictures on the hotel's site. We didn't have the blue bedspreads as seen in someone's pictures. We enjoyed the fireworks. We used the free bus Circular that stopped at the corner across from the hotel and it took us to the Harbour. Because the hotel was a short 5-6 blocks we walked back to the hotel after the fireworks. Parking (oh yea): Valet is $25 flat for in and out service per day; Garage next door could be cheaper for you. It's $15 for a 24hr period, no in and out or $5 for a 12 hr period of time. We used it. This hotel gets my stamp of approval, as picky as I am. It was a better deal than staying at the pricey hotel(s) across the street from the Harbour itself. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: suedi3
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay this past weekend. Coming together from various states for my niece's wedding was a great time for all. The hotel and accommodations were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleF64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont Plaza for four nights, June 22-25. Joanne at the front desk was really helpful when other staff members wouldn't let us check-in because they didn't have a photo copy of the corporate credit card we were using for our room charges. Joanne was great and we were able to check in very quickly. The suites are huge! Almost like a one bedroom apartment. The rooms are just a tiny bit dated in their furnishings, wallpaper, etc., but the room was immaculate which is what really matters to me. Wonderful Gilchrist & Soames lotion and hair products, very lux. The bed was really comfy and cozy too. Every single member of the Tremont's staff was helpful and friendly, from the great servers and hosts at the hotel's restaurant, Tugs, to the bell staff, housekeepers, etc. We were always greeted with pleasant hello's and conversation. The hotel's location is excellent and the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards ballpark are within walking distance. The attached conference center, the Tremont Grand is spectacular and renovated in 2003. What an amazing place to have a conference! The building is historic (built in 1866!) and beautiful in every way. Check out the ladies room at the Grand! Fancy!! Over all, a fantastic experience at the Tremonts!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! Rooms are big and roomy...”
Reviews.Author: Buckbarley
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Rooms are big and roomy, especially for the price! The front desk staff is efficient and very friendly, especially Jessica! Very positive attitude in this place makes you feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: chrisjeffo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice with very roomy suites. Each had a kitchen, dining room, living room, separate bedroom, and bath. We were up on the 23rd floor and had a nice view of the city. We went to a Yankee/Baltimore game and was able to walk back after the game.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: wakecats88
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Red Sox games. The hotel is a short walk to the Inner Harbor and just a little longer to the ballpark. There are taxi's available on a regular basis. The rooms are large with a small kitchen and a sitting area. The hotel was full with Red Sox fans but was also very quiet. We were on the 15th floor and did not have to wait very long for the elevators. We will be going back there next year and will be stayin here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use their valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Baysolitude
Reviews.Content: While there I left my brand new Kia Soul with them in their valet parking area. I turned the car over to them on arrival and took it back several days later. My mistake was in not doing a walk around prior to driving off. On arriving home I discovered damage to my car that could only have occurred there and their insurance company, Travelers, refused to honor my claim. Dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Way below expectations”
Reviews.Author: tmf10
Reviews.Content: We were seriously disappointed by our recent stay at Tremont Plaza Hotel during a holiday weekend. The room itself was barely adequate--our air conditioner broke twice, there was a large hole in the bathroom closet, the mattress on the pull out sofa was thin and lumpy and the kitchenette did not have adequate supplies. Towels were thin and worn and not enough were furnished. No robe was provided. Service was also mediocre--we had to call housekeeping and room service several times to receive basic services. The hotel was definitely did not meet expectations based on website information or the price of the room ($250+ per night).

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel, try somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: jfbibeau
Reviews.Content: First room was on one of the higher floors and close to the elevators - I could hear every single "whoosh" and rattle of the elevators - not very pleasant, sounded like trains running through your room! Front desk promptly changed me to an upgraded corner room, which was appreciated. However rooms really need to be updated. Carpets and chair upholstery is stained, bed mattress was clumpy, bathrooms weren't very attractive. Overall the price paid for the rooms (although roomy) is not worth what you're getting. Watch out for the 20% gratuity and +3.00$ food charge for room service, and don't be fooled by the "high-speed" internet (barely dial-up speeds)! Disapointed overall :( Will stay closer to the harbor area next time.

Reviews.Title: “omg watch your bank account...”
Reviews.Author: takinmymoney
Reviews.Content: I was recently there for a girlfriends night out. rented the suite and it was very nice but when i left and checked my bank account they charged me twice for the room and 2 other charges that i did not know where they had come from..so I called to the hotel immediately to figure out what was going on....they could not find my reservation for 15 min..said i hadnt stayed in the room i stayed in...and they said housekeeping said we were still there when we had left around 10:oo a.m. in the morning and might i add that they were very rude on the telephone ...she acted like life was at an end, very unpleasant people...they had to call me back to find out what was going on with all these charges because it wasnt us..when they called us back they said housekeeping told them the wrong room and hey would refund the money back to my account...well guess what they did that wrong also because then they charged me again for the whole thing so now we are around the 1200 dollar mark...but it doesnt end there...when i call again they said the girl did the procedure wrong thats why i got charged and she would refund that back to me immediatley..but not until I showed them proof that they charged me>>so i did i faxed it straight to them while i was on the phone with them\...she said oh my >>well i am still getting random charges on my account still awaiting them to call me back because every time i call i get transfrered to a voicemail that or they are not there..i really want to get hold of the owner operator of this establishment because i am contacting a lawyer. I would really like to tell them what his staff is doing with other peoples money.....now i am going to change my bank account because of these people! this has taken alot of time and frustration out of my time when i could be doing better things with my day...other than watching my account to see what they have taken today!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mocfan31
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a trip to Baltimore. My wife had been there for business and I joined her with our daughter for a long weekend. We were very disappointed with the room and service. Our room was on the 14th floor. When someone in a room either above us or next to us would use the shower, the pipes made a very loud rattling sound that we could hear. it sounded like a train coming through the wall. The front desk did nothing to help solve this problem. I will say they gave us three days of valet parking for free. The room was mediocre, not updated at all and had a very old TV that did not get a clear picture. The room service food was good but not great. The staff seemed to not really care about the guests and we heard some of them making comments while we were waiting in the lobby. Will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont Plaza was conveniently located in Baltimore for family with toddler.”
Reviews.Author: Hochie1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3-yr-old son to Baltimore for a mini family vacation. The main lures for us with a toddler were the National Aquarium and the Port Discovery Children's museum, the latter being hailed as the 4th best children's museum in the U.S. by a parenting magazine. We checked in on a Thursday evening - very quick and efficient check in. The staff was not overly friendly but rather brisk and pleasant, for the most part. I chose The Tremont Plaza because of their "stay two nights, get the third free" deal at that time and booked a 1Br suite but also booked because of the proximity (short 10-minute walk) to the touristy Inner Harbor area. Our suite was perfect for anyone travelling with a child or children. The separate living/eating area afforded more space for our active son who did not feel like he was in a closet. Quite spacious for a family of three, even four. The kitchenette had a small fridge that was so cold our water bottles froze but quite convenient for the leftovers that we brought back from various meals. Plates, cutlery and microwave also provided. Dishwashing liquid too but had to pick up a roll of paper towels at the Walgreens on the corner. Room is not overly fancy, carpet is a bit dingy but vacuumed every day. We are very low maintenance so could not find fault with too much except for the inconsistent shower temperature. Water went from very hot to very cold a few times but my main concern was that we felt safe, location was good, even the hotel restaurant - Tug's Bar and Grill - provided a great meal. Did not hear any noise from anyone in surrounding rooms. Nice and quiet. Self-parking at the big garage adjacent to the hotel far less than expected. I would stay here again if we ever wanted to go back to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Long Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmoore1808
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont for six weeks while in training in Baltimore. The staff was great and the restaurant very nice. I used the laundry which was clean and felt safe since it was on the same floor as the pool and exercise areas. Other hotels with basement laundries have been uncomfortable for me as a single woman. The pool was nice, a bit small but the hotel has to work with the space they have, nice exercise area. Snack store nice but expensive like most hotels. I had my car with me since I was relocating and that was the biggest pain because daily parking is expensive ($20+per day) and not owned by the hotel. On Fridays and Saturdays, the owner of the parking garage will reserve large sections of the garage and won't let you in. It is best if you don't have a car during your stay. I had a limousine driver take me to the zoo one day so I wouldn't have to take my car out and pay again at the garage. Room was very spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Sr. Manager, Software Company”
Reviews.Author: jovalina
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences. A great place to stay!!! Pam Tarini

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Dee0516
Reviews.Content: My daughter was an outpatient at Kennedy Krieger Institute for two weeks of intensive physical therapy. We wanted to find a place that was not too expensive and close to the facility. I booked a handicapped room on-line and they gave me a great patient rate. The room was clean and large with the most comfortable cotton duvet covers and fluffy pillows, unlike most hotels. The bathroom was easily accesible for my daughter to maneuver her wheelchair around in. The only negatives were that the kitchen area was tiny and the bathroom had no counter space and no full length mirror in the room. Considering we were on a main street, it was exceptionally quiet and very comfortable. We decided to go home for the weekend and return on Sunday night.. The staff at the front desk agreed to hold our luggage and gave us another room . As it turned out the second room was much roomier in the kitchen area and the bathroom with a full length mirror in the room. The only negative thing about our stay was that we were constantly on the go and there is no street parking so we had to get our car in and out of the valet all day long and had to wait several times for them to get it. Also, I couldn't believe they had a free shuttle bus to Johns Hopkins, but no accessibility for wheelchairs. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who needs to go to Johns Hopkins or Kennedy Krieger and wants to stay within 2 miles from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience”
Reviews.Author: suddensam
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Baltimore w/ wife, daughter, son-in-law and 3 grandkids .2 spacious suites made the experience comfortable for all. Proximity (6 blocks or so) to Aquarium and inner harbor also a plus. Amiable, enthusiastic doorman at adjoining Tremont Grand provided an unsolicited but most impressive tour of that historic building.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: neonp
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for three nights initially for some job interviews in the area. Check in was quick, valet service excellent. The restaurant in the hotel, Tug's, had good food, although typical of hotel restaurants, on the expensive side. Just a couple issues; housekeeping did not clean the room on one day of my visit--that said, I had an initial reservation for three days, checked out, the immediately checked back into the same room for an additional night. That was the day that housekeeping did not show up. The morning of my check out, when I had a chance to sleep in a bit, they were knocking at my door at 8:30! Only ice machine was on the 4th floor (this is a 37 story hotel), and the morning of my check out the internet connection didn't want to work. As a previous reviewer indicated, the room seemed to be a bit warmer at night than I like, but I just opened a window! Worked for me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Relaxing Stay at The Tremont”
Reviews.Author: jonathand1018
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tremont Suites Hotel for one evening. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 and checked into our studio suite room (3107) within 10 minutes. Staff at the front desk was very nice and friendly. Room was very spacious and included two queen beds, though I would have preferred one queen bed. Rooms are slighly dated, but this was not a big deal for us. Beds were very comfortable. Two issues with the room: Room was very, very hot (without even turning the air on). A/C function wasn't working (prob. because it was winter, but it would have been nice to have). I've never been so hot in a room. If we had stayed another night, I would have requested out of this room. The other issue with the room is that, when turned on with the remote, the TV would shut itself off seconds later. TV was also very staticky. Again, not a huge issue as we spent the bulk of our time siteseeing. Overall, the hotel was very nice, but wouldn't pay hotel rate for room. I paid $50 before taxes via Priceline.com and got what I paid for, which was fine. Also, checkout was very quick and had our car (which we had to valet) in just a few minutes. I did not use or see any of the hotels ammenities (sauna, restaurants...).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Outstanding Service"”
Reviews.Author: mac861304
Reviews.Content: I wanted to just take a few minutes to respond and say how much we LOVED staying at the Tremont. From the moment we pulled up we were satisfied with the service! The Valet gentlemen were very helpful and accurate with their information. We had a group of about 10 leaving the hotel to go out for the night, and the valet guy came and asked us if we needed anything. He didn't wait until we asked him, but he took the initiation to approach us! The front desk workers were friendly and very nice. We were also very satisfied with the room. Everything was in good order and clean. We will definetely stay here again, and will recommend to all our friends. Thanks for making our stay in Baltimore a great one!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value !”
Reviews.Author: ChopinTaipei
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for ten days for a business trip. I was upgraded to a very large, clean and comfortable suite with everything included-microwave, a nice small kitchen. I have to say it is a three star hotel with a five star services !! The staff are very polite and attentive. I had problems with the internet and they did everything to resolve the problem and had me changed the room for that ! In addition, the location is great ! It only takes about 10 minutes walking distance to the Inner Harbor, downtown of Baltimore. l will definitely stay in Tremont Plaza again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice place - not great location”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: stayed here for under armour marathon in 2009. this hotel was right on the marathon course, so that was a big plus for me. hotel is close to inner harbor, but a bit of a walk. not much directly by the hotel. at least 3-4 blocks to restaraunts and stores. rooms were quite large and had small kitchen. very nice for traveling with small children. was a bit pricey - but got a good deal on priceline. otherwise not worth the going rate nice little deli/store attached to hotel that was not outrageously expensive like some other hotels - a nice surprise. had very nice breakfast and sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and all Inner Harbor attractions are well within walking distance!”
Reviews.Author: simpint
Reviews.Content: I'm usually nervous to travel with such little kids but the staff at this hotel were more than accommodating to our almost 3-year old and our 4-month old. The hotel's location is great and all of Baltimore's major attractions are certainly within walking distance and, if you prefer some meals in, there is a supermarket just a block away. I was also pleased with the variety of restaurants (Turkish and Thai, for instance) within a couple of blocks of the hotel and if I find myself staying overnight in Baltimore again, I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “European Style Hotel with first class service”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghBuzz
Reviews.Content: Attended a Re-Opening of a lounge with complimentary cocktails and butffet. The food and service was excellent yet still complimentary. When I attended a dinner function later that evening in the elegant ballroom the white glove service and attention to detail was impeccable for a crowd of more than 500.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: buddaman
Reviews.Content: Staff untrained and unable to offer proper service for the attempt to be an upscale hotel Resturant is excellent for food but lacking in reception and service to guest. Front desk service has much to be desired in people skills, all in all the bell service has it together, very efficent and understanding with knowledge of the area. be carefull of inroom furniture looks to be of yardsale quality.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recal a more pleasant stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaCheez
Reviews.Content: My pleasure to issue this comment. I cannot recall a more satisfying experience in an urban hotel than our stay at the Tremont Plaza Hotel. The hotel presented an excellent appearance upon our arrival. I admire a polished air, even more so on a Sunday evening. Staff was gracious and intelligent! Booking was just as it should be with our request for a "quiet" room on an upper floor well-accommodated. A special delight was the resort-style "pantry" making light refreshments available. The room itself was detailed and fulfilled every expectation and more, which demonstrates to me a genuine respect for the lodger. It was everything a suite has come to mean to the traveler - very roomy living areas with separate spaces for business and sleep The bed and bath were nothing short of superb. One more point: we paid almost twice as much the next night at a local "big-box" hotel that was recommended to us by our business contact and did not receive one-half the service and comfort we experienced at the Tremont Plaza Hotel. We were unqualifiedly impressed with the Tremont Plaza Hotel! We will be posting this recommendation on various websites. Thomas G. and Brandy Ziesemer Mt. Dora, FL

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: kjturg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Tremont in Baltimore with our three small children. The room was spacious and equipped with a kitchenette, seperate bedroom, pull-out couch, and crib for our son. It was quiet and our shower water was hot. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us. We purchased two nights and got the third night free, very economical. No hidden costs. Very close and walking distance to Inner Harbor. We had friends stay at a different hotel in Baltimore and they liked the Tremont better when they saw our room. The salad bar, sandwich restaurant inside the hotel was awesome too. Thank-you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Spacious with Incredible Service!”
Reviews.Author: Isedelia
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a 3-night getaway in a spectacular Two Bedroom Suite at the Tremont Plaza! The suite was appointed beautifully, with all-new furniture, a huge flat-screen television in the living room, and 32-inch flat-screen televisions in each bedroom. Everything about the suite appeared new and in immaculate condition. Better still was the service encountered throughout the hotel. From the warm greeting at curbside provided by the Doorman and Valet Staff to the bright smile at the Front Desk, gracious service began at the time of arrival and continued through the time of departure 3 days later. Staff in the Plaza Deli, Tug's Restaurant, and the Housekeeping Department all were quick to greet us, and to make pleasant conversation. The hotel was attentive to our every need, and often anticipated our needs without prompting. I absolutely recommend this hotel; for families, definitely select the huge and recently renovated Two Bedroom Suites, as these accommodations are breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: 3canadians
Reviews.Content: We travel a couple times year to Baltimore to visit family. Our experience at Tremont Plaza has always been outstanding. We usually get a suite on an upper floor which provides a great view of the city. The staff has alway been helpful, personable, and courteous. The room is alway spotless and nicely decorated. We find the hotel to be quiet, safe and secure and within walking distance to the heart of Baltimore. Best value in Baltimore, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Different place...Different time!”
Reviews.Author: tmac54
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that our stay was average at best. It could have been outstanding had the staff been more engaged. A few of the hotel associates we encountered seemed distant; our questions were answered but no other information was offered. Question: where's a great place for crab cakes? Answer: the harbor. I guess my wife and I didn't appear to be the tipping kind of guests. Doors were opened and I did see a few smiles just not in my direction... I had to open my own doors! The service at Tugs was outstanding however... we stopped in for a quick lunch and that was the highlight of our stay (10/30/09 at around twleve-thirty pm ...we were seated under the fish tank). Our server not the hostess was thoughtful,funny and just a joy. One last thing...ebonics isn't always required. A white female associate helped checked us out. The line was long and she decided to help out the desk person; from her uniform I assumed she work the door. She took my information and stated "I was good"? I asked twice if she required any additional information from me because we were checking out a day early and both times she replied " your good"! I know what that means but I expected something different ...something a little more professional. Different place ...Different time Note: use a site (not hotwire)where should you need to check-out early or the hotel isn't to your liking you may be able to obtain a refund. Our anniversary that was cut short in part due to our stay at the Tremont.

Reviews.Title: “Great Jazz on Fridays”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three-night stay at this hotel for my husband’s business conference. I agree with other reviewers that the hotel seems a bit worn down. For instance, there was a large red stain on our carpet (hopefully, cranberry juice, not blood), and the carpets never seemed that clean. But we enjoyed our stay, and particularly, the jazz at Tug’s restaurant on Friday night. It is not actually in the restaurant but in a conference room across from the restaurant. The band was excellent and the drinks were reasonable. They serve food also. I would definitely recommend doing this if you enjoy jazz – the place was packed! Pretty unusual for a hotel restaurant. I went to the deli three times. The first time I went, the service was pretty awful. I almost didn’t go back, even though I thought the food was good all three times. I decided to try it again because it is so convenient and the second and third times, the service was fine, so the person on the first day must have just been having a bad day or something. I didn’t experience any other service issues with the hotel - I found the front desk and bellman to be helpful and friendly. The neighborhood is not great but it isn’t terrible. When we decided to walk around after checking in, there were a couple of angry, screaming women and a lot of mad looking people around the hotel. The next day, when I had a lot of free time, I walked around a couple of the neighborhoods and found some really charming places within walking (or ferry) distance from the hotel. I would recommend Federal Hill, Little Italy (great Italian food) and Fell’s Point and also the neighborhood close to the George Washington monument, which is an easy walk from the hotel. We stayed out til 10:30 or 11:00 most nights and walked home with no problems so I guess it isn’t that bad. A fun evening place walking distance from the hotel is Howling at the Moon (dueling pianos) at the Power Plant. The hotel has definitely seen better days, but we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Old Hotel w/ non-existent service”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay for two nights and left after only one night. For arrival and departure there was no assistance with luggage, but the bellmen were willing to at least watch me. (Do these folks want to earn a gratuity?). Check-in and check-out were mere formalities with no assistance; but you did get a non-smoking lecture, and were required to sign a form that attested to your non-smoking or suffer a fine (a hotel first for me). The real irony is that the room reeked of smoke! LOL. (It was all a moot point since I don't smoke.) The bar/restaurant was a joke. Essentially charm-free with surly service. Likewise with the deli - it's hard to imagine how the service could get any worse. But the grossest part of the whole stay was the balls of hair in the corner of the bathroom tiles. Disgusting. Tub also had hair in it. And the vainty shelf was hanging by a thread. The bed looked slept in and the mastress was so worn it looked like a hammock. I slept in my clothes for the one night there. All in all a very dirty old hotel with no ambience. P.S. Take a book to read while you're waiting for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation in Central Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: baol1969
Reviews.Content: If you look for a place at reasonable price close to Inner Harbour, Tremont Plaza can be your choice. Not specially fancy or stylish, a bit run-down but still very efficient, clean and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at a great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: bsage
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. Everything about it was excellent. We stayed on the 28th floor overlooking Baltimore, walking distance to the inner harbor, the gym was immaculate, laundry, great deli inside and restaurant and they were doing a great special where if you stayed two nights you got the third free so the price was right. The only bad experience was when I walked outside to smoke a cigarette and one of the bellmen rudly said Leave the property maam!!!!!!!!!!! (I was unaware that you cannot smoke out front of the hotel)..........Also...the bed linens were wonderful. Super soft and cozy like home

Reviews.Title: “great service...AGIAN”
Reviews.Author: fourfours
Reviews.Content: i have never felt the need to write any review anywhere. i travel extensively and have had all kinds of accommodations from dumps to palaces. i have been to tremont plaza about 5 or 6 times. this past weekend i traveled with my father to see a ravens game. i again chose tremont. fantastic front desk(erica). fantastic shuttle driver(james). fantastic bartender in tugs(adrian?). the place is always fantastic. cant beat the deals on rooms. i got one night full second night half. my total would have been one night at the hilton. the shuttle is like your own limo. never a need for a cab. like i said i never post reviews since everyone sees things differently but i'll never understand the bad reviews on this site for this place. felt the need to "stick up" for tremont. you cannot go wrong here...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff ...great stay”
Reviews.Author: mcleary1224
Reviews.Content: While visiting U Maryland with my son I decided to add a day in Baltimore to see the Ravens Game/Stadium. I lucked into noticing that the Tremont had a football fanatics Package that included a night at the hotel,valet parking, and tickets to the game! (tough ticket to come by) We arrived early Sunday to just get the tickets, but to our suprise they allowed us to check in and valet the car. From the front door to the room the staff was outstanding. They even offered to shuttle us to the game. Later the front desk helped me print out my 24 hour prior boarding pass for SouthWest. Spent some time in lounge Tugs and the bartender called the shuttle to take us to Espn Zone Inner Harbor. The rooms are large and comfortable. There may be closer hotels to the stadiums and harbor, but I doubt you'll find a better staff than you will at the Tremont. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Worried about reviews”
Reviews.Author: stubbs234
Reviews.Content: We are going to stay at the Tremont This Friday Sept. 25th because it was recommended from John Hopkins Hospital. My son is disabled and he has to go to the hospital for further testing and treatment. I am really worried about the reviews I have read as they are mixed I am still worried. Some of the pictures worry me also. I have to be very picky where we stay due to my sons conditions. I will give a real review when we return next friday.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a single night but staff needs to be more attentive.”
Reviews.Author: crtgal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Tremont to attend a reception. The hotel was adequate for a single night stay. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The suite was spacious. The furniture needs updating as it was worn and dirty in places. The linens on the bed were unraveled and worn, although clean. The padded mattress cover was ill-fitting and would pull the sheet off the mattress if either of us rolled over or otherwise moved. The bathroom tub had mildew and the caulking around the tub and toilet needs to be removed, cleaned and reapplied. We had to ask four times - FOUR TIMES! - for extra sheets for the sleeper couch and towels. The third time we actually went down to the lobby to ask in person and it still required an additional request. Very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good room, staff needs to be more attentive”
Reviews.Author: I_like_to_travel_MS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Labor Day long weekend. We arrived at the hotel around 3:00pm in the afternoon and a room wasn’t available when we wanted to check in. (Which is odd but it does say on their website that check in is at 4:00pm) so we parked our car and left our number with the front desk which promised to call us when the rooms were ready. Needless to say we never received a call from the front desk, so we showed up at the hotel around 8:00 – 9:00pm to complete check in. Stayed on the 21st floor, facing the street. The staff at the front desk during both our check in attempts were not friendly and did not give us any information about the hotel and what was available at the hotel. We later found out that there was a very nice bar/grill right next to the hotel on our own. It would have been nice of them to give us some information about the hotel (like where is the pool, any other amenities of the hotel, is breakfast included, other details) during check in. The biggest annoyance was that when we were checking in the valet parking guys outside the hotel mentioned that self parking was included and that all we needed to do was to validate our ticket during checkout but during check out we found that wasn’t true and had to pay $35 for a day and 4 hours of parking! Because of the not included parking I will not stay there again. With such a high parking rate it doesn’t make sense to stay at this hotel as you can get a better hotel for the combined price (hotel + parking) that includes parking. Pros: - Spacious rooms - Clean - Location pretty central (walked everywhere) - Beds are very comfortable Cons: - Parking is not included (makes a big difference) - Not friendly front desk - Front desk didn’t provide information that would have made our stay better

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: jennamack
Reviews.Content: Good things first: -location close to Inner Harbor -pretty clean -valet staff super nice -incredible, new fitness area (I am picky about this) Bad things:' -front desk staff totally indifferent -rooms run down -nonsmoking hotel smells like smoke in our room -wireless didn't work in room -you can't call down ahead for your car -layout of room very strange, hard to see tv from bed I got a good deal on Hotwire but won't ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseBlond
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR Suite which was ideal for our family. Having separate sleeping areas and 2 TVs was nice especially after a long day of walking around the inner harbor. It was also nice to have a refridgerator to store cold drinks. The location was great since it is close enough to walk to the inner harbor. We stayed from a Sunday to Wednesday. Unfortunately, there were inconsiderate guests with late night partying. One group threw beer bottles out of their room onto the pool deck resulting in the pool being shut down from Monday to Wednesday. Dissappointing for the kids since they only got to swim on Sunday when we arrived but what can you do? The pool and pool area is small but the kids did not seem to mind. We would stay here again because the suites were good value for the money and the hotel staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, But Didn't Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: stickie29
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Baltimore the first wkd in Aug for a wedding....We are from Calif and flew all the way to MD b/c one of my best friends was getting married. She wed at the Tremont Grand, so we simply booked a room at the Plaza next door. We originally requested a king bed, and were told upon check in that there wasn't one available. So we asked for a queen and were told our room had 2 queen beds. Actually, it had two double beds. I am almost 5'8 and my boyfriend is 6'4. We don't fit in a double bed! We decided not to complain, as the hotel was full and we were on there for 2 nights. The room did have a kitchette, which I could see as a plus if you were there for an extended stay. We stored some leftovers in the fridge and it STUNK of fish inside. Gross. Obviously the carpet hadn't been cleaned in the room b/c there was a huge pink stain near the dining table. Clearly someone had spilled punch or kool aid and it had never been properly cleaned. The bathrooom was extremely small and cramped. I understand it is an old hotel, but the closet was bigger than the kitchenette and bathroom combined!!! I mean, what?? Why? The worst part was that their was a blood stain/streak on the door jam between the bathroom and closet. Nauseating. I didn't even want to take a shower after that. We told the cleaning lady on our second day there about the blood, and she just smiled and laughed. I didn't pursue the matter since we were checking out the next morning. All in all I was disappointed with this hotel - the only plus was that we were able to see the Inner Harbor before the wedding and it was quick walk back to the hotel before we had to get cleaned up.

Reviews.Title: “I'm excited to stay here but also concerned.”
Reviews.Author: hommiz4life
Reviews.Content: I'm sixteen and i found this hotel for my family. The website looks great and a 1400 chairman suite two bedroom looks great but i'm concerned about the bedding. Some images show a dated kind of material as bedding and then some show a newer white bedding. Is there a way you request what type of bedding you want? or is it a luck of a draw. Well i hope we get a bedroom with newly furnished bedding

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy123
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing deal for this hotel at $49 for a 1br suite. The front desk staff at check-in were really nice and got a high floor as requested. The room was very large, albeit with slightly dated decor, however that didn't take away from the fact that it was very comfortable with a nice couch in the spacious living area and a large round tble in the dining area plus a nice kitchenette with marble counters! The bed was very comfortable and had a down blanket and good pillows. The view of Baltimore and a little of the harbor was beautiful as well from a high floor! Would stay here again and even pay more than I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: mds77
Reviews.Content: I've been planning my trip to see an Orioles/Red sox game since last year and booked this hotel in March knowing places fill up quick. Not knowing anything about the area, this place worked out great for us! Its only a couple blocks to both the Inner Harbor and Camden yards and all of the attractions. Our room was spacious and I loved the fact I had a microwavve and fridge in there as well. The staff I encountered were nothing but pleasant, friendly, and extremely helpful...including Alex from the front desk. She helped me get an extra night (I booked the first 3 nights on hotwire, but then we decided to stay an extra night) in the same room. The staff at both Tugs restaurant (including the great bartender!) and the deli were over the top friendly and it made me feel welcomed. I enjoyed the ameneties the hotel had to offer, the great rooms, super comfy bed, and the location. Fabulous time overall, thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise for my son :-)”
Reviews.Author: triciamfa
Reviews.Content: I am surprising my son with a trip to Baltimore on October 11,2009 to see a Raven's game...my son has been playing football forever, well since he was 7...he's 16 now...and playing OLine on the London Falcon's for the summer. I feel I lucked out with our future stay at The Tremont it looks like a fabulous hotel...I went through hotwire and it's always a mystery as to what hotel you get until you pay for it. This site is so helpful in getting various opinon's on the hotels. The review of Tremont sound excellent...I am so looking forward to our stay...we will be staying from October 9 to the 12th. I was wondering if the hotel has an airport shuttle and is the Raven's Stadium very far from the hotel. Thanks from London, Ontario Canada :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MissBKLYN
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at The Tremont Plaza Hotel. Cozy bed ( I felt like spending my whole day sleeping in the warm cozy bed), the room was spacious, Love the atomsphere, service was great. Yes, I have to admit there was 2 problems one was with my room card and the other was with the bathroom lighting. Every night it seem like I had to get a new card or recharged it. Very annoying I must admit, especially if you were coming in late at night. Problem was sloved. The bathroom lighing was working but after awhile I had to take a shower in the dark, for what every reason forcing me to keep my bathroom door open. Other than that, I hope to visit again. I really would prefer an upgrade on my next visit, that is only if it is available.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: More-Smiths
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband, who was attending a work conference. I was impressed with all aspects of this stay. They put us on the top floor without our asking, and the view was spectacular. Everyone we spoke with -- front desk, housekeeping, restaurant -- was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was perhaps the most smartly designed we'd every stayed in -- a logically arranged suite that used the space well and kept us both comfortable throughout our stay. The bed was extremely comfortable. The pool (a small one, which is to be expected in an urban area) was sunny and clean. The location was great for sightseeing and close to lots of dining. This hotel has reset my expectations for future hotels.

Reviews.Title: “So close & yet so far”
Reviews.Author: riverman4fun
Reviews.Content: At first I thought the hotel was great. Had gotten a decent rate & AAA discount with Free parking. Problem was the service was not very good. People were nice enough, they just talked a good game. We did not have enough pillows for the Pull-out for the kids. Houskeeping came up to make the bed after 2 calls but could not find a pillow. The next day, my wife put out the please service card, and maybe they thought it was a do not disturb, but they did not clean the room. Again 2 -3 call to get it resolved. The Fridge was not cold. The room was not dirty, but not really clean, carpet felt a bit sticky, and the bathroom really needed a good going over. Too bad since the room was big (studio suite big enough for the 4 of us) & hotel in a decent locattion.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: yellowgolf21
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, the room that we booked was not available. We had booked a 2 queen bed suite. The hotel ended up giving us a 1 bedroom suite with a queen bed and a queen pull out bed. We were on the 17th floor, facing other building. NO GREAT view to brag about. The pool was suppose to be open until 8. We got there at 6 and is was already closed. I had 2 very upset children. Sorry, but we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with rate change”
Reviews.Author: psychoboysmom
Reviews.Content: I previously wrote an unfavorable review of this hotel because of very poor customer service while I was making my reservation. Hopefully this issue has been rectified. However, the day after I made my reservation, I received a call from a reservation agent noting that I had indicated my son and I were traveling to Baltimore for him to be seen at Johns Hopkins -- she immediately offered us the reduced patient rate at the hotel -- a savings of $50 per night! This was an unexpected and pleasant surprise. It was very nice of her to notice we were coming as patients and offer us this rate when we were not even aware of it. I have much better feelings about staying in this hotel and will certainly review it after our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly comfortable and a steal”
Reviews.Author: AKPonthego
Reviews.Content: I felt this was a great room for the money. Though a bit worn and no view to brag about, the room was huge and very comfortable. The bed, linens, and pillows (the most important part!) were top-notch (definitely comparable to a Westin heavenly bed). The fitness center was also really nice. My husband and I went to Tugs for after dinner drinks and dessert. The live music, excellent service, and delicious treats made for a great time. My only regret was that we weren't in or a little closer to the waterfront. I didn't feel safe walking back at night, as the immediate neighborhood around the hotel was a little questionable at that hour.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant...”
Reviews.Author: kramn
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a surprise anniversary stay at this hotel last night, June 25th and I had a wonderful time. The hotel is not far from the harbor, it overlooks many of the other buildings in the city so you have a pretty good view all around. We stayed in a room on the 37th floor, the highest floor, and it was absolutely gorgeous. The rooms were clean and well kept and the bed was soft and so inviting, I didn't want to get out. Since we forgot our toothpaste and shower cap they were able to supply that for us, but the first time we called the guy at the lobby desk seemed to have no clue, so we ended up having to call again and in no time we had what we needed. The hotel is not far from quite a few restaurants, which you can get to behind the hotel on Charles street if you walk to your right. All in all we had a wonderful stay and would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, great bar”
Reviews.Author: Kooka67
Reviews.Content: Was in Baltimore for an Orioles game and booked this hotel through Hotwire. All I can say is don't pay any attention to the negative reviews. This place is GREAT! Very spacious rooms, very helpful front desk and bell staff. Never had any problems. Tugs has great bartenders and wait staff. The walk to the Inner Harbor is shorter than it looks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great people,wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: rickcasi
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Baltimore and we plan to go back.....There is no way you could meet better people..The rooms are large and there are 4 elevators..Tugs is a bar and restaurant on the 2nd. floor and the people who work there are the best we ever met..They have a happy hour and room service or takeout....It is a great walk to the inner harbor and ball park...This hotel may have a little older rooms but it makes up for it in value and people...We plan to go back and do most everything again....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: busylizzie3514
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. My husband and I travel to Baltimore frequently for ballgames and this location is fantastic, only a few blocks from the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards and the Ravens stadium. We checked in early with no problems, and once we parked the car in hotel garage we never moved it. We walked everywhere. The hotel staff was so friendly and there is a great little deli right off the lobby with modest prices. There is a supermarket across the street which would be handy if you are staying awhile and the small kitchen in the room is a great amenity. The hotel is a little older and may not have all the updates of a newer classier hotel, but it's certainly more than acceptable, was very clean and tastefully updated. I know what downtown hotels usually go for, and we got a great deal on this hotel. If there were any downsides, it was that the showerhead could use an update (my husband was especially unhappy about it) and we ended up stuck in the parking garage for about 45 minutes while we waited to get out in rush hour traffic in addition to the traffic letting out from the game--nothing the hotel could do about that. All in all, a great stay and I'll definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good deal for downtown area”
Reviews.Author: missrachelj
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Tremont Plaza Hotel. It was very convenient to the downtown area, and within walking distance of the Inner Harbor area (about 6 blocks or so). We were able to find free parking across the street from the hotel (normally permit parking weekdays) so we were happy about that. There was a street with restaurants and shops right around the corner, which was also very convenient. I had read that the neighborhood was not that great, but we didn't see any problem with it. As for the hotel itself, we had no complaints (except for the fact that the first room they sent us to was not cleaned because the last person there had left a 'do not disturb' sign on the door - but they immediately had another room for us). The room was spacious and pretty clean (a little dusty in some areas though). It was nice because it had a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and a few dishes in case you needed those. The beds & pillows were very comfortable too. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Mitre10
Reviews.Content: I'm quite suprised reading the previous reviews compared with my experience. I was blown away by the staff of this hotel--their customer service was the best I've encountered. I stayed at this hotel for two weeks, attending a conference. I brought along my infant son and my husband. Upon check-in, the person at the front desk upgraded us from a studio to a 1-bedroom so that we could stay up while our baby slept. Anyone who has ever had a baby who doesn't sleep very well can imagine how great this was, especially when facing a 2-week hotel stay. A couple of days into our stay, we asked for a fan to provide white noise (we were waking the baby, the hotel was quiet) and they gave us the fan from behind the front desk. One day it was raining really hard and the girl at the front desk lent me her personal umbrella for the walk to the convention center. We also needed a ride to the aquarium, which they provided free of charge (though they prioritize those going to John Hopkins, as they should). My son dropped his pacifier in the lobby and the bellhop brought it back up to our room. The people in the deli knew us by name and were just wonderful to us. They arranged corporate passes for us to go to the aquarium, saving us a lot of money (these aren't always available). I was truly impressed by the customer service at the hotel, it went above and beyond expected courtesy. The rooms were good--nice sheets, large size. The tv froze a couple of times, causing us to miss the end of House and all of the Office :(. Other than that, I was really happy and highly recommend the Tremont Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “More Like Fleamont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: AshBert
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for one night last August for a friends wedding - thank god we had some drinks in us the night we had to sleep here or we would not have been able to get over the condition of the room. Overall, this place was a disaster, but the worst part was the cigarette burn holes in the sheets, the foul odor from the previous guests smoking in the room mixed with mold, and nersty little hairs all over the place: the shower, the sheets, the floors. It was filthy. My fiance and I are both non-smokers, but we decided to just deal with it since we are pretty easy-going people and figured the other rooms were probably in just as bad shape as the one we were in. BAD IDEA! A few days later we saw a charge for a couple hundred dollars on our credit card statement from our friends at the Treemont Plaza. When we called to inquire, and they said that they chared us with a cleaing fee because we "smoked in our room". Hilarious since neither of us smoke and hate the smell of cigarettes. We thought "no big deal, we'll just tell them the room was like that when we got there". Another bad idea. The hotel "had no proof" that the room smelled of smoke and refused to reverse the charges. We spoke with the supervisor and then the manager to no avail. We got fed up and eventually just had to pay a fee and have the credit card company decline the charge. How is that for service?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: setonmj
Reviews.Content: Had a one night business stay at location and was pleasently suprised regarding some comments given before. Room was purchased via Hotwire ($67 per night). The only slight qualm is that there wasnt any hotel parking unless you valet park for $25...the parking garages are much cheaper (we spent $8 on a Sunday parking). Hotel has a deli on the lobby level and a resturaunt (jazz club) on the second level. Hotel has 37 floors and our room on the 36th floor. It has a great view of Baltimore and the room was roomy for a one bedroom suite. We have traveled to Baltimore several times and this is one of the best hotel stays we have had.

Reviews.Title: “How Can this Be Called a Plaza Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: JaMichel
Reviews.Content: I had an horrible experience with this hotel; I had to ask for 3 times a room-service. I had to change my room after one night. This was really a very bad experience. Forget about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Inept staff, decaying rooms”
Reviews.Author: schmengi13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont Plaza because a friend's wedding was being held at the adjoining Tremont Grand. While the wedding was fabulous, the hotel was anything but. We had to be moved from our first room because it looked like my three-year old daughter had been placed in charge of cleaning the bathroom. We tried calling down to the front desk but we quickly learned that the phones in the rooms are for decoration only -- no one who works at the hotel ever picks up. We should have just packed it in, but the convenience of being near the wedding encouraged us to stay. In retrospect, I would have rather hiked in each day on foot from Glen Burnie. As problems arose (and they arose often), the staff exhibited an exquisite combination of apathy, ineptness and laziness that was truly remarkable. For example, the wedding party had a hospitality suite. Despite being reminded repeatedly that the suite needed cups and ice for the guests, the cups and ice were omitted. After the suite filled with 40-50 thirsty guests all unable to drink anything, we called down numerous times asking for someone to hurry up with the cups and ice. Eventually, we improvised and got them ourselves. A staffer finally showed up over an hour after we first called and clearly didn't care whether the room was on fire, much less if we had ice or were having a pleasant experience. Rather than having a dedicated service elevator, the staff uses the guest elevators. Since the "staff floor" is 18 (out of 36), you are guaranteed to pick-up and drop-off staff members on every elevator ride. Don't be in a rish, because you will be late. I finally had it when I called for my car on check-out. Amazingly, someone answered when I hit the "valet" button on the phone. (I had temporarily forgotten where I was staying and believed the phone to be real). When I asked for my car, I was told that I had to present my ticket. I said, "of course I'll present my ticket when I come down, but please pull my car out so its ready." I was told that couldn't be done without first presenting a ticket. WHAT IS THE PUROPSE OF CALLING THE VALET IF THEY WON'T GET YOUR CAR OUT FOR YOU? After waiting for three elevators that I couldn't get in because they were filled with staff members, I got down to the lobby 15 minutes later to retrieve my car. I could not drive away fast enough. Simply put, this hotel is poorly run and the staff (with the exception of the valets, who were all very nice) was incompetent and dismissive. I stay in hotels all the time, both for work and pleasure. I have not encountered such a bad experience in a long, long time. Please, please -- stay away. You don't deserve this kind of frustration.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for Mercy Hospital”
Reviews.Author: chaucer66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because my wife was having surgery at Mercy Hospital, which is directly across the street. The rooms are very large and comfortable (if a bit dated looking), and the small kitchen is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “an unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: chickie807
Reviews.Content: During my stay, some cash went missing from my hotel room. I believe it was the housekeeper but what I was disappointed in was the way the hotel handled the situation. I knew I would never see the money again so I just asked the front desk not to send housekeeping to my room for the remainder of my stay. Housekeeping came every day for the rest of the trip, the one request I actually did have. Instead, they sent up all kinds of hotel personnel who spent about 1 1/2 hours questioning me about the missing money. The worst part is that they promised to follow up with me and get back to me with their "investigation" and I never heard from them again. It was quite a headache and upsetting. They also had some problems with the lock system, and no one's keys worked for about 10 hours. Overall, a frustrating and unfortunate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal; Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: boshmd
Reviews.Content: Had to stay overnight since conditions were icy and could not get home and i must say i was impressed by property and staff. Did not know hotel was there since a little off beaten path of downtown area but still close to my office and rate was good, room was clean and staff accomodating to late checkout. Fridge did not work but that was minor inconvenience. Had a nice cocktail hour on business floor Tuesdays which was nice but needed crackers to go with the cheese they served. While accomodations are not on the same level as some of the upper end hotels, I thought for the price the room was very reasonable and would stay again. Actually went back next day and had lunch at deli which was very nice. Would stay again given choice as its a nice alternative to some of the more pricier hotels when all i am looking for is a nice, clean room, comfortable bed, convenient location and serviceable staff. Call me very pleasantly surprised...definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “ignorant of requests and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: winnowedsoul
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the lobby is very utilitarian a chair a table and large door, not a place to meet up or wait comfortably at all. Check in was tedious as was the checkout, certainly NOT express. They require a $50 deposit onthe room on check in and if it is on debit, they have the odd official policy to double charge that and it is stated on a sign on the front desk. The staff in general lacks personality, personability, interest in guests desires and satisfation. The rooms were large enought o be comfortable but the bathrooms have no space for personal items and the tub and toilet are uncomfortably close. The bathtub/shower drain had hair upon my arrival at 5pm and my toilet seat was comming off. The toilet was quickyl fixed and I was optimistic, yet themaid was sent to clean but that hair remained until someone came again at midnight. I also requested several more hangers that also took until midnight. The mini fridge was unplugged and smelly and when l pugged in sounded like it was ready for take off. Dishes in the cabinet were dusty and there were an odd assortment of dishes no two anything matched and there was only one plate and one spoon, two bowls two saucers a fork and three butter knives.
