Hot water was a problem though out the trip(Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday) and I was told they were only at 20% compasity so it took a while (15 minutes actually) for the water to be hot enough to shower. Everyday I had to request my room to be cleaned and even had to wait one day until 4 pm when I had a client for a short meeting. The room was never cleaned unless by request and after 3pm. The embarassemnt was not worth the money I saved by staying here that a client has to see a very inattentive housekeeper though our whole meeting, only then to walk by the room service tray that stayed in front of the elevator for 2 entire days, no kidding. There are no service eleveators I take it because you frequently ride with housekeeping staff and pack full the small space even though there are 4 elevators and stairs. The visiablity of maintence and housekeeping staff is constant but things never got cleaned. I found it rude and unprofessional. Ice can only be gotten on the 4th floor I was offered NO up grade or discount and any questions I had about the area were answered by being handed an inroom book of local attractions. There is no personal service, motel 6 is more likely to be clean and up beat and they usually have a breakfast which the Tremont lacks. The bar had no one in it and when we asked the band be quieter they laughed at us and continued to play terrible, loud and to an empty house. The bartender was ignorant of the wines list and unable to provide a proper wine service. The room was worn with stained carpets, bubbled up wallpaper, all doors, tables, and chairs had the tell marks of serious vacum scratches. The couch had stains as well as the flattened, worn and stained mismatched throw pillows. Stay at your own risk of shoddy housekeeping, ill informed/trained staff and medicore to terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “overall a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jonekb03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont for 2 nights while in Baltimore for interviews - the hotel is a 10 minute walk to the University of Maryland hospital and a quick drive to Hopkins. I got an outstanding deal through Priceline. My suite was huge and very quiet. Because I was able to park in hospital garages during the day, I parked on the street overnight. There is ample street parking after rush hour but you have to move your car in the AM by 7 or start feeding the meter at 8 depending on your spot. This is probably too much of a nuisance for most and I think the $12 overnight garage next door to the hotel worked well for my traveling partner. My room was very clean and the cleaning staff was very friendly. I used the fitness center and found it to be clean and in good working order. Complaints: there is no wireless internet in the rooms (but evidently it is available in public areas according to the website?). Ethernet worked in my room (after I realized I had to turn OFF the wireless on my computer). There was no free internet access in the business center - you had to swipe a credit card to make the computer do anything. Seems like other hotels I've been to provide complimentary access in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tremont Plaza Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cocoaeve
Reviews.Content: The trip to Baltimore was a birthday present to my sweetie. We checked in late because traffic from New York to Baltimore was crazy, and our bus arrived almost 2 hours later than what it was supposed too. On arrival to the hotel, we were plesantly greeted by the front desk staff and was quickly checked in. I must say I was plesantly suprised when we opened the room to our studio suite. It was goregous. I didn't expect to see so much space and clean. The kitchette was great, a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker with coffee, a sink, yes I said a sink, and also in the cupboard there was tableware, glasses, silverware and a toaster. You don't expect that in most hotels, and it did come in handy when we went out to buy food. The bathroom wasn't as small as some stated but it was bright, clean and the toiletries were great. Also had an abundance of towels. The king sized bed, let me tell you about this bed. Omigosh I just looked at it and knew it was comfortable and believe me, it was the best bed I've ever slept on. Clean crisp white sheets, a down comforter and the pillows. My sweetie is a pillow hound and so am I and we had enough on that bed for the both of us. I've never slept as well in any other hotel as I did here. I wanted to take that bed home. The housekeeping staff was excellent. Asked us if we needed extra towels and even left them when we didn't. The gym, was great, I didn't expect that many machines, and updated machines with televisions, just like the ones at my gym. I took advantage of it, and loved the fact that I was able to work out. Wanted to use the sauna but didn't know how to work it but it was clean and spacy and was just great. The only think I hope they will update is the television. It's kinda small I think about 19 inches but upgrading it to at least a 27in or even a flat screen would be sufficient. Oh the Sunday morning staff at the Deli, was very great, my sweetie had them cracking up and we even looked for the girls to say goodbye when he checked out but they weren't there. One of the workers name's was Chanice. Her, her supervisor and the other co-worker were just great and mad the best sandwiches. Please let them know that the couple from New York said hello. We had a great time at the Tremont Plaza and the staff was excellent, they all deserve a raise!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Mr76er
Reviews.Content: The condition of the room (30th Floor) was abysmal. There were bottlecaps, nut shells, and candy wrappers around the bed,closet, and nightstand. There was a good deal of red mold growing on the ceiling of the shower. The thermostat in the room did not work, and even with open windows, the temp would not drop below 75. The front desk also could not provide a second key . The location is pretty good, but cleanliness is clearly not a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience on business trip”
Reviews.Author: CmonLetsGo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tremont Plaza for 4 nights in early November in order to attend a professional seminar at the attached Tremont Grand Venue. My room was on the 34th floor. The room was very spacious and clean, and the view was terrific. The floor was very quiet, allowing for restful nights. The hotel staff was wonderful, and the restaurants (sit-down on the 2nd floor and deli on the 1st floor) had very good food. The hotel even offered a complimentary happy hour on Tuesday night, with great food, wine and beer. I have no complaints about this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great, accommadating staff and nice location”
Reviews.Author: ForCheapSake
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-night stay in mid-August for my family (wife and 1 year old) through Hotwire. I was able to get $79/night which was an absolute steal. From the onset, we were treated very well. To accommodate our little boy's nap schedule, the staff allowed us to check in early. The room was a huge suite with a kitchenette and free wi-fi. I was able to hit the gym (with TV's) while the boy and wife napped. The location is nice- walking distance (10 minutes) to the Inner Harbor but not in all the hubub and craziness that also comes with an Inner Harbor Hotel. The staff also suggested using their valet instead of public overnight parking as it was cheaper for us. All in all, I can't complain about anything at the Tremont Plaza. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggys
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend the Tremont Plaza to stay. It is located right across from a hospital so if you like hearing ambulances it's not very quite. The Valet scratched my car while we stayed there. To make matters worse they refused to vacuum my room because I had some small papers on the floor, I had to borrow their vacuum and do it myself which took all of 2 mins. My bathroom had mold growing on the ceiling which was not too hygienic. Overall it was not a quality stay and I would recommend you choose another hotel to stay at while in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms later, they finally got it right!”
Reviews.Author: BuzzyMD
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, Front Desk staff was not able to accommodate our request for 2 beds. Instead, we were given a room (#1109) with one bed and a very uncomfortable sofa-sleeper. The floor was very moist and pretty gross. We did not feel safe taking off our shoes until actually in the bed. The TV also turned on/off on its own and half of the channels did not work. The next day, we requested a room with 2 beds, we were told nothing was available until 2 days later (although perhaps they could have re-assigned us a new room as people were checking out?). We endured this room for two nights. Afterward, we were given room 506, a two-room suite. It was quite spacious, however the main room had no furniture (other than the Murphy bed). While we could overlook this, the real problem was the raw-sewage smell from the bathroom. The toxic stench could be considered a safety hazard to anyone with respiratory problems or severe allergies. Additionally, there was a lack of window treatment! With nothing to block the streetlights, it was like trying to sleep in broad daylight. We reported our concerns to the Front Desk staff, they appeared indifferent. After speaking with a manager, Paul M. We were promptly assigned another room, #3105. Finally, this room was a nice, suitable room for four people, with 2 beds, and furniture. At least our last night would be restful. The noteworthy issues for this room: the TV turned off/on its own and no water/plumbing for 2 hours. Other than these matters regarding guest rooms, the actual meeting/banquet rooms are quite impressive. I would certainly want to host or attend an event in those rooms. I appreciate the proximity of the hotel to the Inner Harbor and other Baltimore attractions. The manager, Paul M. was certainly a bright star, however the front desk staff could benefit from customer service training and improve upon general job knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to the Tremont.....”
Reviews.Author: patlynn
Reviews.Content: We were in Baltimore to see the Red Sox games a few weeks ago and stayed three nights at the Tremont Plaza. We had a super early flight on a Sunday, but we were not able to check into the room early. We were able to leave luggage and go off to explore the city. Upon return to the hotel around 2:00, we were still not able to check in..woman told us "4:00." We did get our swim suits on and head up to the pool. The pool is the only big negative thing I have to say about the Tremont as there is a huge generator smoke stack right on the side of the pool and all you can smell is very strong diesel fumes. I couldn't take it and headed back to the lobby to wait. While waiting, I noticed that others were being checked in, so I headed back up to the desk. The same woman could only say, "not until 4:00." I went back up to the desk after witnessiing yet another couple check in and this time a male took care of me....he said that others were being checked in because they had higher end rooms and that as rooms became available, they would let us know.....then he looked on the computer and found a room. I think it is probably becaused I booked the room via Hotwire and this is why we were made to wait. Can't understand why they want everyone piling up in the lobby until the 4:00 deadline! Oh well. I did get a nice room on the 22nd floor and was very pleased with it. We were called at 10:00 p.m. by management that night telling us that the 22nd and 23rd floors had been booked and interviews would be taking place for a couple of days with people waiting in the halls. They offered to move us at that time or the next a.m. We decided it would be best to move and we were upgraded to a beautiful one bedroom on the 35th floor with a great view.....and we were given vouchers for breakfast the next a.m. as well for our trouble. I thought management handled that very well and was much appreciative to be moved instead of the noise we would have encountered staying in the old room. The room itself was very clean and I never felt squeamish. The bed was unbelievably comfortable with down/feather mattress pad, down comforter and great pillows. Frankly I would have rather stayed in bed all weekend! The bathroom was huge with a double sink and included Gilcrest and Soames products. The little kitchenette area was clean as well. The plumbing was quiet in this room, but we did notice that it was much louder on the 22nd floor. As well, the water pressure was not so great on the 35th floor, but we had very hard water pressure on the 22nd. So, I think it is hit or miss with these two issues. Of note, we left money on the table for the maid after the first night and it was not touched. I had to leave a specific note for her so she would take it. Bravo! The hotel's restaurant for breakfast was very reasonably priced and the food was great. The waitress was very friendly. Enjoyed breakfast. There is a different happy hour offering at the bar each night. It's a nice place to have a night cap if you don't feeling like walking to the harbor. There is a grocery store right behind the hotel as well as a Starbuck's. We opted to walk about a mile to Whole Foods Market to get a few things. The only other issue that might bother some people is that the hotel is a bit of a walk to the inner harbor and surrounding Baltimore neighborhoods such as Little Italy, Fells Point and Federal Hill. We must have walked 15 miles in three days. There are homeless/bums all over the city and it seemed worse this year. You just can't avoid them. I didn't feel frightened walking back from the ball games, but if it were a random night with no others out there, we might have felt worried. The City really needs to address this problem. If you are in Baltimore on a Sunday, there is a great farmer's market only a few blocks from the hotel. You could easily have breakfast or lunch at this market. As well, we went to Attman's Deli on Lombard for incredible sandwiches, Nick's in Cross Street Market in Federal Hill for crab, Vaccarro's Bakery for cannolli's and finally Kali's Court in Fells Point for crab and Kali's is the only place that I wouldn't return to. Of note, we took public transportation from the airport. We bought tickets for the light rail, but found out that light rail doesn't run until 11:00 a.m. on Sunday. So, we jumped on a bus that happened to be there and took the bus into the city. We had a map from a previous trip and didn't have a problem walking and finding the hotel from where we got off on the bus. The closest light rail station is Lexington Market, but I would not use that station at night as the surrounding neighbor is not great. Upon returning to the airport at the end of our trip, while waiting at the Lexington Station in the a.m., a kid hopped up on drugs did approach us, but my better half is a big guy and scared him off. If you can't handle this type of situation, you might want to pay for a very expensive taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Tremont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: nickfromct
Reviews.Content: After reading many poor reviews, I was a little nervous coming to the Tremont Plaza. We got the room on Hotwire for less than $100, which was a bargain given the Yankees were in town. After spending two nights. here we would stay here again. The room was very nice, updated and in good shape. The kitchenette was had a new fridge with freezer and a microwave, great for restaurant left overs. The room was spacious and the beds comfortable. The free high speed internet was nice as well. The service was quite good I thought. Everyone was hardworking and accomodating. The location was ok, a little out of the way. Its about a 5-6 block walk to the Inner Harbor and a little more than that to Camden yards. Overall, we had a very good experience at the Tremont Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Would suggest”
Reviews.Author: snowmoe23
Reviews.Content: We had a fine time at Treemont. Stayed there two nights for a wedding, despite future reviews I would recommend the hotel. The pool on the 4th floor is cute, small, but a nice outside hotel. When I arrived the lobby was packed and there was only one staff member behind the desk, but she was going as fast as she could. It only took about five minutes to get checked in not a big deal. Rooms were nice two beds, and nice kitchen for left over’s, or wine and beer. The only think that was a bit slow were the elevators, however I was only on the 7th floor so I just took the stairs. Many people in our party were staying in the top floors and said they never had issues.

Reviews.Title: “Ignored Guest”
Reviews.Author: sch08835
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very excited to attend the 4th of July in Baltimore. My wife did some research and found the Tremont Plaza fit our needs. We needed a two bedroom suite since we were traveling with my in-laws who are elderly. Now onto our experience. We arrived at the hotel at 4pm, the check-in time that was on our reservation. I was the only person in the lobby upon arrival and the front desk person was on the phone. As I approached closer I overheard her conversation was of a very personal nature. I waited for around 10 minutes before the front desk clerk acknowledged my presence. She did not hang up the phone she just asked for my information and continued talking on the phone. She looked three times and then told me she was having a problem locating my reservation. She turned her back to me and said into the phone " i have to go, this guy is trying to get in without a reservation". At this point I started to become upset. She left the desk and returned with what i can only assume was a manager. Who did three or four key strokes and the suddenly I was in the computer. We were given our room keys and headed upstairs. the room was tired, carpet was dingy and the bathrooms was overall not very clean. that aside the kitchen area was fine for our needs. The first two days of our stay was pretty much without events or issues. Other than asking for towels and having to call three times to get them. On our third day we left for a day in Baltimore and when we returned 6 hours later the room was not serviced. I called the front desk to ask for the room to be serviced. the front desk person was extremely happy and said she would have someone come right up. About 45 minutes later an employee showed up and asked if they had come up yet. I told them no and they left. Needless to say they never showed. In the morning I called for towels and they were brought up. When we left this day I stopped at the desk to ask about getting the room serviced. I was assured it would be done and the manager apologized. When we returned to the room again about 6 hours later, the garbage was emptied but the beds were not made, no towels were changed and the carpet had what appeared to be water spilled on it by the door. I called down to get someone to come up and the same routine followed from the night before. At checkout, I asked to speak to the manager. When I spoke with the manager I explained all that happened, she was apologetic. She didnt seem suprised or shocked. She took my bill and came back with another one a few minutes later comping me one night stay. I have to say i was shocked that this hotel was this bad and the service was so poor. I am keeping this to the room issues. I dont even want to get into the bar service or the deli. that is whole different bad story. i would not stay here again or even let anyone I know stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good from afar, but far from good!”
Reviews.Author: PDXshark
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying all the below comments were brought to the attention of hotel staff and management on numerous occasions and nothing was done. Getting the Reservation: Recently I had a group stay at the Tremonts. We had four rooms reserved. From the beginning there were signs of trouble. When reserving the rooms, the staff was very rude. We also had a hard time getting a hold of anyone as the phone is not always picked up. Getting Into Our Rooms: After flying across the county from the West, I arrived with a group of 12 individuals (with kids). We arrived at the hotel at 6:30pm. Check in was at 3:00pm. When we arrived at the hotel we were informed that our rooms were not ready. They were changing their entire computer system and they were experiencing problems. Fine, we understood and waited in the lobby. We were told that "any minute" we would have our rooms. A few minutes turned into 1 hr and 30 minutes waiting in a lobby. Upon talking with the staff numerous times we were always told "any minute." We were not the only ones. We were in a lobby of about 12 other individuals with the same issue. Even though our group was first, everyone else was issued rooms before us. Management had no comment as to why this occurred. When we were issued rooms, all the rooms were not the what we had requested. Management fought with me until I showed a printed receipt from their email confirmation. Up until then, I was told by the manager that he had given me what I had reserved. That conversation ended when proof was given. Again, no apologies. The Rooms: The rooms are great if you just need a clean bed for the night. The rooms are older. All of our plumbing (four rooms) were labeled backwards so beware. Having a stream of hot water hitting you while you think it is cold is not fun! We had to call plumbing on one room as the faucet handle fell off. They did come and "fix" the problem, but it broke 10 minutes later. Service: Overall the service here is poor. Internet is free here, but we didn't have a cable. We called down for a cable and told it was "on its way" although we never received it. This hotel is independently operated so the manager always has the final word. In our case, the manager was not helpful at all. Nothing was every done to our bill. In general nothing was done at all. The manager had ample time to satisfy our complaints as we made him aware upon check in and check out. We were very glad we only stayed here one night. We moved across town to a Marriott and I am glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jpeace121
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Tremont recently. I was in Baltimore for a training event, and a block of rooms at the Tremont was reserved for us. So I can't speak to the reservation process, but I can offer a review on the rest. I was very happily surprised with the size of the room. Mine had separate dining and living rooms in addition to a separate bedroom. Not knowing the Tremont was a suite hotel, I was not expecting that. The room was well furnished and very clean. Bedding was very nice, and the bed itself was very comfortable. I had dinner at the restaurant in the hotel the evening we arrived. Even though we arrived rather late, the restaurant was happy to serve us. This hotel is in a great location. It was a short walk to the Inner Harbor, which provided plenty of entertainment for me on the one free night I had while in town. Overall, a very nice hotel. I would consider staying there again in the future if I was in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed was here”
Reviews.Author: bburleigh
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline for 5 nights while we were in town to watch some baseball games. Was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised by what we got. We arrived at the Baltimore train station and decided to walk to the hotel since it was a nice day. Its about 12-15 blocks but we are a couple of young guys and it was no problem. Check in was easy and our request for double beds was met with no problems. Opened the room to our door and was greeted with a large room with Queen beds, a small but adequate kitchen, huge walk in closet area and a decent bathroom. Only drawback was our view was the broadside of a parking garage, not a big deal. The front desk pointed us to a nice grocery store just up the block where we could stock up our refridgerator for the week. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor and about 8-10 blocks from Camden Yards. All in all a great week and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk transfered my reservation from Tremont Park to the Plaza at the same rate I had even though the Plaza rate is higher. Nice bright clean room, updated decor. My room was very quiet even though it was next to the elevator; I didn't hear a thing. I always request to be far away from elevators and ice machines because I hear everything, not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PD2K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a friend's batchlor party. The hotel staff is friendly, but the hotel itself is nothing special and is very dated. My suite had a refridgerator and microwave, but the room was average. The bed is comfortable. Hotels guests have to pay for parking. It was very overpriced for what I got in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a few updates”
Reviews.Author: sash813
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad place to stay. It was quiet and spacious and clean. The only complaint that I have is that the bathrooms are in need of major updates. The water pressure sucked (maybe because I was all the way up on the 30th floor), the lighting was poor and the exhaust fan and countertops were non-existent. On the flip side, the room service was quick and tasty and the bed had big king sized pillows. Not the Renaissance but a hell of a lot better than the Brookshire!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at Tremont”
Reviews.Author: jbout
Reviews.Content: Check-in is 4pm but the rooms weren't ready at 4pm. I was told the rooms could be 30 to 45 minutes before they were available. I gave the front desk my cell phone number to call me when they were ready. I called 1 hour later and the rooms weren't available. I again gave them my cell phone number to call once the rooms were ready. I called the hotel again 2 hours later and the rooms weren't ready. Finally, I called 3 hours later and the rooms were ready. The hotel never called me to inform me of this. By 7pm my group was already attending an event that we had to get ready for in the restaurant bathroom and we weren't able to check into the room until 11pm. I emailed the hotel and told them about my experience and asked for some sort of credit or rebate since we didn’t get full use of the room but they never responded. The management company of this hotel is completely ill-equipped and uneducated in hotel operations...they were unprofessional and I would have been much better off staying at the Marriott (and so will you).

Reviews.Title: “Not Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: hairston
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Tremont for one night. Hotel is in a good location, about a 5-10 minute walk to the water. Staff was friendly. Our double bed room was not ready at the time of check in so we were given an option of waiting (which I did not want to do since we wanted to get settled and the lobby was filled with loud volleyball tournament teenagers) or take the one bedroom suite w/ sofabed. We took the one bedroom suite. I won't make the same mistake again. The sofabed was not comfortable at all. At check in I was advised we would be pleased with it. There were only two large towels in the room, unfortunately there were 3 of us. No extras? I thought that was unusual. No vent in the bathroom so everything was slick and wet. Kitchen had dish soap to wash cups, etc but nothing to use to clean the items with? No paper towels so used tissues. Tremont website looked much better online then in person. Used business center and had to pay $5 for 2 minutes on the internet. Most hotels I've stayed at offer free business center internet services. Besides the location I cannot think of any other reason to go back. Slightly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for inner harbor, ballpark, convention center area”
Reviews.Author: akd07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month while on a business trip in Baltimore. Our event was at the convention center which is an easy 1/2 mile or so walk. This is within walking distance to the inner harbor shops and also the Camden Yards ballpark. The rooms have a small kitchenette area, a living room area and then a separate bedroom and bathroom space. Plenty of room. Everything was clean and well-kept. There is a small convenience store/deli attached to the hotel which is great for a cup of coffee or a quick breakfast. We ate at the hotel restaurant, "Tugs", one day and this was also good. This is a good hotel and I definitely recommend it if staying in Baltimore. There are fancier hotels closer to the harbor, but for the price this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheSmithsBermuda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Tremont Plaza Hotel recently to stay during a follow-up visit to Johns Hopkins Hospital. Last year, we literally lived at Tremont Plaza from August through December, while having treatment at Johns Hopkins. The Tremont Plaza Hotel staff were wonderful to us on both stays. Returning to the hotel was truly like coming home. Tremont Plaza offered us the most genuine, caring and still very professional service that we have experienced anywhere. We highly recommend Tremont Plaza for the convenience -- laundry, exercise room, restaurant, deli, near shopping and Inner Harbour, shuttle service to all including hospitals -- but most especially we recommend it because the people who work there are terrific. If you need a home away from home in Baltimore, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Montehall
Reviews.Content: We just sayed at this hotel in mid-March 08 and it was great!! They helped us with (but didnt guarantee) an early check in and the valet ($25 per day) had the car waiting when we got down to the lobby in 2 or 3 minutes at worst. They also helped us in calling a cab right from the front desk and there are a few resturants within the hotel as well. You could walk to the Inner Harbor in 10 minutes or its a 5 minute car ride. They also have a shuttle that will take you to and from the Inner Harbor. This is the place for people looking for location to everything. Its probably a 20-25 minute walk to the Orioles and Ravens stadiums as well. I check Trip Advisor evry time I'm looking for a hotel to see what people are saying and it seemed good as far as reviews and the hotel exceeded our expectattions. Definately a winner.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here if you go to Baltimore !!”
Reviews.Author: HELENMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tremont Plaza Hotel for a conference in February of 2008. It was an excellent choice. The food was outstanding. The attached Tremond Grand is where our meetings and meals were held. WOW ! Breathtaking and worth every dime. We were able to get out of the hotel and wander around the Inner Harbor which has a lot to do for all ages. It is locateda cross the street. But the best thing about the hotel were the employees. Professional, elegant, happy to be there, greeted everyone all the time with a smile, very helpful and accomodating. There was a fire alarm during our stay and I ended up walking out of the building with some of the employees. They all knew exactly where to go, stayed calm, answered questions, and acted professional even though they were left unsupervised for a few minutes while everyone gathered outside. I work for a hotel, and I would hope my staff acted in the same manner if this happened at my property. Fires happen, we all know that. But don't you want to stay in a place that has trained on how to handle emergencies? Mr. Haynie (GM) should be very very proud !

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ConferenceMgr
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Plaza used to be an apt building, so each room is really like its own apt, with a kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. So space is not an issue. Having the full size fridge, microwave, and dinner plates/utensils is a nice touch! Only complaint, and it's significant, was that they are renovating the hotel, which is a good thing, but construction crews started on the room adjacent to mine at 6:15 am, and with the walls being as thin as they are, I honestly thought someone was in my room. I'm also a grown man and can cuss like the rest of them, but the contractors were using foul language that even made me blush, and all I could think was what if a family was staying in my room and kids heard this! I complained to the front desk and they stopped work on that room until I checked out a few days later, so it did get taken care of. But beware of the paper thin walls. There's a nice deli/convenience store on the lobby level, and a pretty good but small restaurant on the property. It's within walking distance of the inner harbor, but it's not right on the inner harbor, you have to walk up a hill to make it back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water!”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen12
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a trade show. I checked in and then took some clients to dinner. When I returned that evening I valet parked my car and went to my room. I was surprised at how large and nice it was, especially the bathroom. I went to bed early as I needed to be at the Convention Center at 6:30 am. I scheduled a wake up call for 5am, so I could shower and check out. My wake up call came in at 5:10 am, and I went to get into the shower. I turned on the water and found it to be freezing. I let it run for a few minutes while I did some other things, and it was still freezing. I called down to the front desk and they said "Oh yes, that happens this early in the morning on that floor, wait an hour and you should have hot water." Wait an hour? I have to leave in an hour!!!! I asked if they had another room, with hot water, that I could use to shower. I was told that they were fully booked. Luckily, I had friends (from another company) staying in the same hotel. I called their room and was able to use their shower. I checked out, and explained how frustrating my morning had been. I was not offered even a word of apology, just a "yes that happens on that floor". I then had to wait 30 minutes (causing me to be late to my event) for my car to be brought by the valet-yet I could see my car parked down the street! Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladida0105
Reviews.Content: Was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The people in the room next to us were having a party until 6am. Security didnt do anything except continue to warn them. So we got no sleep that evening. Also the pullout couch was so uncomfortable. It was flat and you could feel all the springs digging in your back. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_s_BermudaHeart
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Tremontplaza on St. Paul's a second time.The staff are great.I would go back all the time for that area. Cybele Dalmas-Lewis Sandy's,Bermuda

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: I'd not expected much of this hotel, given some reviews. But I found it convenient, friendly (the staff went to great lengths to help even when it didn't really matter that much) with good large rooms. The conversion of the old Masonic lodge to an events venue is worth a peek while you are staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Plateglass
Reviews.Content: No problems at the Tremont. Can't understand the previous negs? Got a junior suite on the 25th floor and everything was fine, even the fact that i don't like heights. Large room with Queen bed and all the usual bits which were of a reasonable quality. Bathroom was again average but no problems. Room was clean and well presented. All the staff were fine as was the sports bar on the second floor(even served after hours due to there being a crowd of us). One special mention needs to go to the deli shop on the ground floor. Great sandwiches and great staff. Given the fact that Hotwire got me the room for $72 + tax aside, this hotel is very good value, particularly as it is in the heart of downtown and only a 10 minute stroll to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fall visit”
Reviews.Author: sharon17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tremont Plaza. Very nice hotel and very friendly staff. After one nights stay we were asked if we minded moving from a room and being upgraded to a suite for the rest of our stay as they had to do some work in the room next door. We didn't mind! They then sent housekeeping to help us pack and move to the 34th floor. Views were great. Food at restaurant was lovely and plentiful. Bar is friendly and cheap. Deli in the hotel. Our own kitchen with fridge and microwave. Only problem was that shower had little power and took 5 minutes to run through hot. You must go to Koopers on Fells point. Food is great and very cheap. Visit to the railroad museum is a must. It is a good walk but worth it for a half day trip. Go in to the Bank of America and look at the foyer. It is fantastic! Went to a game at the Ravens stadium. Friendly helpful people wherever we went. Day trip to Washington is cheap and easy on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We likd the Tremont Plaza - on arrival the doorman was really friendly and helped us out with parking advice and showed us where the waterfront was (just 5 blocks down, an easy walk) Our room was big and well appointed and for $139 not bad for a downtown hotel. I think Baltimore as a whole can be 'dodgy' and two blocks back on our trip in the locals looked decidedly unwelcoming. We did however as 3 young women walk around at night without once feeling threatened and the inner harbour area was really welcoming with lots to do. My only gripe with the hotel was having to wait ages for a lift (elevator) as I think they only had 4 old lifts for 37 floors!

Reviews.Title: “Average, bit of a hike to the harbor”
Reviews.Author: hwt.
Reviews.Content: This hotel could still use some updates. Roomy suite was a plus. They allowed me to check-in early and the customer service was generally good. Ten-fifteen minute walk to the Inner Harbor. Wouldn't recommend it at night either. The hotel borders on some interesting neighborhoods. Limited food options in this area after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: mj250
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with co-workers. Room had musty smell. Everything looked outdated and worn out. About 7 to 8 blocks from Inner Harbor - not safe for 3 females to walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl4355
Reviews.Content: If you like up to date well maintained rooms...this is not the hotel to stay in!!!!! When we arrived at our room I was greeted by 3-4 huge stains on the carpets along with a couple of iron burns. The toilet seat was broken, the bath room seal around the tub was rusted, the air filter was filthy, nasty and crammed with dust and the paint was peeling in the closet. The walls were full of marks and the TV's are small 21' and 19'. I also noticed a lot of tape hanging from the ceiling, my dish detergent was half full, I was provided coffee, but no creamers or sugar. I looked on the ceiling and was tape hanging (I just they did not clean up after the last guest left). I asked them to move me to a new room and they stated they would have it ready when I returned from dinner. The new room was much like the last one (very smart Tremont). the air filter was still dirty, my carpet was freyed by the bathroom and had a huge air bubble in it and the wallpaper has several air bubble in it as if a amatear peeling. This hotel needs to be reconstructed or they need to drop the price from $249 to $49.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel to stay in with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: JerrysDaughter
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, my 13 and 16 year old sons just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel and enjoyed it very much. The room was spacious even for the four of us in the one room. It contained a bedroom area, a sitting area, a small kitchen, dressing area and full bathroom. While an older hotel, it was elegantly appointed and very clean. The staff was very friendly and very eager to help with all that they could. The major draw-back was that both beds in the room, although queen size, were very, very uncomfortable. For the price, the location was quite good and located within walking distance (6 blocks) to the major attractions. The hotel does, however, provide free shuttle bus service to destinations within 2 miles of the hotel which is a very nice service. There is an outdoor pool, but it is very small and was not enough to entertain teenagers in.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Dissatisfied with Tremont Plaza Hotel on St. Paul Place”
Reviews.Author: baltimore33
Reviews.Content: I reserved a one bedroom suite and stayed for one night. Upon my arrival, we immediately dropped our bags off and went out to tour the city. Upon our arrival back to the room, there was a big garbage bag near my door from housekeeping. Was a little shocked because it was after checkin time. After getting settled and looking at the room, I discovered the room was not kept up well. The closets definitely needed a paint job, there was a lot of scuff marks on the walls. The doors to the bathroom and the bedroom were in dire need of painting. The bathroom was disgusting. They took a door off a closet and put shelves in it to hold towels. Leaving the expose tracks on the floor. On the ceiling of the closet you could see mold spots and the walls needed to be washed down. The toilet and the bathtub needed to be rechaulked. The blanket on the pull out couch had a violet stain on it liked they tried to wash it out, but it still showed the stain. Since we did not examine the room completely after checking in and was only staying one night, we decided to stay because it was very late when we got back to the room. Upon checking out, I spoke with the manager and explained that I was very dissatisfied and would not only recommend this hotel, but would be writing my comments on tripadvisor and expedia. She said she would try to get me a complimentary stay because of my experience. Still waiting, not sure if it will happen.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at Tremont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: UTdp1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on Hotwire for $99 per night at the Tremont Plaza for 5 nights in August 07 for a business conference. Excellent value for the room compared to other hotels in the area. I had a room on the 37th floor. Great view of the city. My only complaint was that there was not much water pressure in the shower, other than that the room was a great deal. I had associates that stayed at a hotel only 4 blocks away and paid a lot more for a smaller run down room. I will be going back next summer and plan to stay at the Tremont Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brinagirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tremont Hotel in Baltimore was simply wonderful. Trip advisor made the entire process so much simpler due to the wonderful reviews they have posted. The hotel was spotless and our suite looked like a little apartment. A seperate kitchen and bedroom and a very spacious living area. The breakfast in the morning was really good....a little over priced, but worth it. One tip....if ording the french toast, make sure it's NOT on rye bread. It kind of ruins the sweetness. The staff was nice, some nicer than others, but overall very nice. Parking is a bit expensive if you vallet, but there is a parking garage next door where it's only $10-$15 for over night. Some other reviews said the beds were uncomfortable....I had a great sleep. Not sure about the sofa bed, but our friends didn't complain. We will definetly go back!!!! To make the trip even better, we went to La Tavola's in Little Itally! I have never in my life had better food!!!!! A MUST GO!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “love it, love it.........................”
Reviews.Author: Red-Soxs-Traveler
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, didn't know what I was expecting but it was better than I could have thought....stayed on the 24th floor, great view, clean room. Tugs is great, stayed open later for us (too many red sox's fan for them to close). The deli a little bit expensive but if you needed anything right away at least its there or two blocks away is a Walgreens.. Only 6 blocks from the Inner Harbor, the hill that people talk about is nothing but of course if you have some sort of disability then it could be but not a bad walk at all.... Highly recommend can't beat the price we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranpol
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel and I loved it, this was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The room was very clean, the beds were very clean and good to sleep on. The best thing about the room was the view it was awesome we were on the twenty fourth floor and you could see for miles. the front desk staff were very nice and helpful. Tugs restaurant was very very good for breakfest, lunch and dinner. overall I loved this hotel and would 100% stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: rentgirl98
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went in june 07 for a weekend we had just got married two weeks prior. it was bad they didnt clean our room till 530 pm on our second day and all they gave us where 1 free drink each. the beds where hard as a rock i dont think that this hotel is a 3.5 at all. i would stay at the hyatt. they offer a shuttle service no one ever picked up the phone to pick you up never again would i stay here and also at night not a good area to be walking in we took cabs at night

Reviews.Title: “Booked through Hotwire - it was great!”
Reviews.Author: VTJerseyGirl03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and a few friends and I booked this hotel the week before we visited Baltimore for one night. We got a one-bedroom suite with a little kitchen area and a pull-out couch. The hotel was pretty close to the two places we wanted to visit - Ram's Head Live! for a concert and the aquarium, of course. We parked in the garage next door and it only cost $4 since we arrived on Saturday and left on Sunday. (During the week it's $12 per day, but the weekend max is $4.) Don't pay $25/night to valet park on the weekend - park in the garage! It took us about 15 mins to walk to the Inner Harbor and to the little downtown/restaurant area where Ram's Head was. It would have also been a cheap taxi ride. For breakfast, try the Plaza Deli next door - the restaurant in the hotel is very overpriced, and the bagels at the deli are great. We also had lunch at the deli and the sandwiches were awesome. The service at the deli sucked, but the food was great! Overall, since I booked the room on Hotwire, I only paid $172 for the night and I thought it was worth it. I don't know that I would have spent any more than that on this suite though for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Medusa4755
Reviews.Content: My previous lodging arrangements fell through last minute so I was forced to take the only hotel with only 1 room left, this one, and a king suite + a sleeper sofa... which wouldn't have been that bad except I'm only one person. First off there is never any parking in Baltimore. Second, there is REALLY no parking during Otakon. I had the valet park my car, which was wonderful so I didn't drive around looking for parking that doesn't exist. The valets and the bellhops were very friendly and kind. I'm sad to say I can't say that for the front desk staff. I was ignored most of the time, and when I wasn't being ignored they were being snippy with me. Maybe it was because I was in my Otakon costume or something, but that shouldn't matter, my money is as green as the next guest's. Just for a little experiment I'd like to go back there one day dressed in my work suit and see how differently they treat me. I had my accounts compromised 2 weeks earlier, as such, my bank shut my cards off while the fraud investigation is going on. They are supposed to give me new card numbers, but boy did they pick the most horrible day to shut the old ones off. I used an old one the day before, and it worked, so I wasn't sure exactly when they were going to be turned off. Well, when I tried to check into my hotel, the people at the front desk were really rude about how the card was denied. Well, duh, it was turned off, I knew it was going to happen, I just didn't know when. So there was this whole fuss how they needed another card in case of incidental damages or something like that. The room was already paid for online, while my card still worked... but they wanted another one! So I had to call my mother up and have her fax over copies of HER credit card. It was a big hassle over nothing! The room was already paid for, I was all by myself, all the cash I had was for the convention. They were trying to get me to pay $310 in cash to them for the room I already paid for online! If you think a single, white female roams around in Baltimore with $310 in cash in her pockets you should think again. Though the city was very crowded, even at night, because of the convention. It was a lot safer than normal with so many people at all hours. I did not get hassled by anyone while I was walking back to this hotel in the middle of the night. For all the other women traveling alone out there... be aware of your surroundings all the time know how many people are around you at all times and if you notice any unusual activity (people who are parked next to your car's driver's side and not getting out of their car immediately), stick to the main roads that have street lamps, don't talk to anyone you don't have to, don't stop walking for any reason, don't give money to the beggars sleeping on the benches near the fountain, stay away from people who are talking to themselves, and don't go into any parking garages without an escort. Valet service can save your life... When I got back to the room, I noticed there was a bachelorette party in the room across the hall... they had taped a sign up on the door. They weren't that noisy, I was surprised. I was so tired I took a shower and fell asleep immediately. The bathroom was ok. The tub needed to be recaulked, though, but atleast it was clean. There was a tiny kitchenette in my room also, which was nice. They gave me free water bottles, and free coffee packets. I wish they would've given me more creamer and sugar though. I thought for sure I'd get a continental breakfast the next morning. Well, they do serve breakfast, but it's not for free, which defeats the purpose of a continental breakfast in my opinion. I think for $310 for one night I should've atleast gotten a muffin or something. But whatever, I bought some peanut butter crackers the day before from a gas station. I went down to see if they would hold my bags for me for the day, dressed normally in jeans and a t-shirt, it was kind of cute how they didn't ignore or act rude to me that day. In short, if I was to do it all over again, I'd mix the valet and bellhop service with the Days Inn right in front of the convention center. Maybe then I'd get my free breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: MaltaInNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for me through work. I was there for 2 nights. The first night was fine, was assigned a large suite which was clean but the bed/pillows were extremely uncomfortable. When I tried to take a shower in the a.m., the water wouldn't even go on. I flew 3 floors down to a friends' room and showered there. A housekeeper who caught this whole scene was nice enough to inform maintenance of my problem and assured me that it would be taken care of as soon as I left. When I arrived about 6 hours later, the water in the tub was running - apparently all day! There was a great deal of sediment in the tub and everything was filthy. The toilet nearly exploded every time we tried to flush it and the water in the tap now ran brown. I found out that it was because they were flushing out pipes but couldn't they have given us any notice? A very sweet maintenance man showed me to another room down the hall and I moved everything in there. However, late at night I discovered that the bathroom was not nearly clean at all.. there were hairs (not from one's head) ALL over the floor and what could have been a drop of blood under the sink. I was so disgusted that I couldn't get out of there fast enough. I realize that many people stay there for the rates/location but I'd rather pay more money next time and get something that's actually clean.

Reviews.Title: “2 Bedroom Suite - Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: jinara
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five adults that stayed in the two bedroom suite for three nights. With two bathrooms this worked well when all were trying to get ready in the mornings or for an evening out. The living/dining area is extremely spacious with a large dining table and a full size refrigerator. There was no cooktop, only a microwave. The beds (1 queen and 1 king) were comfortable, but the sofa bed was not. It was nice to be able to open the windows for fresh air during the night instead of using the air conditioning. The only gripe is that there was no wireless internet and with five laptops we had to wait our turn to use the wired (but free) internet connection. All of staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. Requesting our car from the valet parking took less than five minutes during off hours, but can take up to 20 minutes during rush hour since the car has to be driven around the block--a problem if traffic is at a standstill. There's a handy deli off the lobby and the self-service laundromat was convenient since we were on a 10-day 4-city trip. The walk to the inner harbor was manageable (and faster than a courtesy van or taxi during rush hour). We received a Johns Hopkins University rate, which made this hotel a great value, but even without the JHU rate, it is still an excellent value for the two bedroom/two bath unit. It is highly recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lilacglass
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in early May. The hotel is an $8 cab ride from Penn Sta. Check-in was quick. The hotel is near the harbor and close to Charles St. Everything I needed was within a 15-minutes walk. (I'm from NYC so am used to walking.) The room had a queen bed, a small couch, and a TV that swiveled on the bureau between the two. There were big windows and practical furniture. Best of all, a tiny kitchenette with a usable sink and fridge and plates and cutlery for two. The usual coffee maker and the very unusual complementary large, bottled water. There's a supermarket a block away so I could pick up fruit and whatever else I wanted to have in my room. The room, bathroom and kitchen were clean. The bed, very comfortable. The room was quiet at night. I suspect, from talking with some of my colleagues, that some rooms are not so quiet or comfortable. But I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “ewwwww!”
Reviews.Author: ds103n
Reviews.Content: First the hotel was in a shady area, when we got there during the day it seemed fine however upon walking back after dark we were so alarmed at the area. Second, when we walked into our room it was Large and the bathroom was large, however upon turning on the light in the entrance there was a huge piece of FOOD thrown in the light and it took the front desk 3 days to take it out! GROSS!!!! We were supposed to stay here for 5 days but checked out after our conference was over and moved back to silver spring!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: TSpikes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to a nice weekend with our son and his wife who live in Baltimore. We had stayed at the hotel before on several occasions, but it had been about 18 months since our last stay. I was so dissappointed by what a difference a year and a half can make. My wife arrived to check in before me. Though there was an army of bell service personnel, none bothered to help her with getting the luggage out of the car. When she went to the reception desk and handed the desk clerk the reservation we had printed from the website, the clerk tossed the paper back and in a rude and dismissive tone said " I don't need that". As we had been before, we were looking forward to a nice renovated room over looking the harbor. We had reserved a "premier suite". She had arrived at 2 and she finally got a room at 4. When I arrived and saw the shape and smell of the room, we immediately put in a request for a room change. When I asked if the room I was being switched to was nicer, the front desk person said "There is no way I could know that, I am down here at the receptions desk". Though the switch was better (carpet cleaner and not peeling up from the floor) , the bathroom was in need of repair. Mainly though, it was the attitude of the front desk staff that soured our visit and we will not being staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance?”
Reviews.Author: meribor2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Baltimore for Easter Weekend. The hotel is situated in the Inner Harbor area, but if you want to hike it, bring comfortable shoes - the clerk at the desk said the Aquarium is 6 blocks away, but it was certainly more than that! I had booked a King suite through Hotels.com; when I got there, the front desk said the room they gave me was a king, but when I went upstairs, it was, in fact a queen. Note: Any room number ending in 09 is next to the elevator shaft, and it is LOUD! I went back downstairs and complained, and the concierge - a really awesome guy - put us in a king room on the 34th floor. Great views, the bellhop is great, and it was clean...but the bed was among the most uncomfortable I've ever attempted to sleep in. Mushy pillows and a rock-hard mattress! Skip the room service and the hotel restaurants - we got some fruit and baked goods downstairs in the deli (there is also a nice breakfast place just down the road, towards the Inner Harbor), and bring your own body pillow! They have a shuttle which goes back and forth to the attractions at the Inner Harbor (Aquarium, Harbor Place, etc.), which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “If this is 2nd best, I'd hate to see #3”
Reviews.Author: t15
Reviews.Content: This was allegedly the #2 hotel in Baltimore, but was in the bottom 50% of hotels I've seen. The "suite" consisted of one very basic room with small "queen" beds with tiny pillows, a couple wooden chairs and one small table. The staff was disinterested, the mandatory valet parking is $25, breakfast is not included and the pool is closed until late May (its outdoor on top). I didn't bother to explore the "exercise room" after experiencing the inhospitable lobby. The internet connection is free, but is slower than dial up and not worth the effort. I stayed on the 12th floor which had an average view, but imagine the top floors might have a much better view. At least the elevators are quick and quiet. I stayed at the #1 Baltimore hotel last visit and agree very much with the rating. Unfortunately Henderson's Wharf Inn was booked up this trip, and I was stuck with this very average hotel. Trip Advisor - you got this one wrong, unless #3 - 56 are awful!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctdon
Reviews.Content: Hello, Spent two nights here this week on a business trip. Convenient central downtown location, close (healthy walk) to Inner Harbor area. Spacious clean studio room with a seating area, kitchenette (microwave, fridge, 2 plates, cups, saucers), large bathroom with great towels, free in room fast-ethernet internet connection, large comfortable bed. Room on the 35th floor had great view over Baltimore. Very quiet for a big and busy hotel. The four elevators,used by the friendly staff as well as the guests, ran quickly- never waited more than a minute or two. Bar was pleasant, restaurant ok. Front desk check in and out quick and very nice staff. Reasonably priced and secure parking next door. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good for long stays, but a little underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: panicked
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Tremont Plaza on St. Paul Place twice now. It definitely has its good and bad points. I would stay there again if the price is right. The good points: - The hotel is now 100% non-smoking - The rooms are very large - Self-serve laundry facilities - Free internet - Two TVs in the 1 BR suites - Kitchenette, kind of like Noah's Ark. You get two glasses, two cups, two saucers, two plates, two knives, two forks, two bottles of water, etc. Mini salt and pepper, a toaster, a microwave, coffee maker, and a small fridge. - I've found the rooms to be very clean and the furnishings in good condition The bad points: - The decorating is uninspired, and the rooms feel very sterile - I was underwhelmed by the housekeeping. I would often return with no indication that housekeeping had been there except for a hastily made up bed, and the toilet rim left up, or a big wad of toilet paper floating in the bowl. - They advertise Gilchrist & Soames toilitries, but even in the deluxe rooms you get two generic black plastic bottles -- "Conditioning Shampoo" and "Moisurizing Lotion." They feature the Tremont logo and "Made in China". - Housekeeping doesn't take away dirty dishes, and there's no straightforward way of doing your own -- no dishsoap, dishtowel, sponge, etc. - The plumbing is VERY LOUD. I was woken up one morning by what I thought was jackhammering, but turned out to be the pipes banging in the next room over. - The location is so-so. It's a bit of a hike to the Inner Harbor. I would recommend this hotel for people who are going to be here on business for an extended period of time. The separate bedroom in the deluxe rooms would allow for some privacy and space if you were traveling with someone else. It's not a place I would recommend for a romantic getaway. I've found the prices to be fairly competitive. The 10-15 min. walk to the harbor can save you $150 a night on equivalent accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tremont Plaza”
Reviews.Author: HannaM
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Tremont Plaza in December 2006. We booked the hotel online and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The price was good but what we got for that price was excellent! A huge comfortable room with a great view (I think we were on the 30th floor). Two double beds, lots of pillows, nice bright bathroom, large walk-in robe/luggage room, kitchenette (microwave, refridgerator). There was also a laundry available for guests to use. The room was spacious, clean, well-lit and warm. There is an ATM in the lobby and a cafe that has a good range of light meals and snacks. There is a shuttle bus but we didn't need to use it as the hotel is within easy walking distance of attractions such as the Washington Monument and the Inner Harbour, Aquarium and Camden Yards. I had heard that Baltimore was not very safe but the doorman told us that it was quite safe to walk to the Inner Harbour and we felt perfectly safe. Overall, we were very happy with our visit to the Tremont Plaza Hotel and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price but....”
Reviews.Author: hisgirl41
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel during the Thanksgiving holiday. We usually stay at the Hilton Hotel when we visit Baltimore but the prices were too expensive. My cousin suggested this hotel . I went online and found a great price for the 3 day stay which added up to the cost of one day at the Hilton Hotel. We were impressed by the professionalism of the staff, the location of the hotel(10 minutes from my cousin (by car and 15 minute walk to the harbor). If you drive, there is a supermarket about 10 minutes away and there is a bank, drug store and fast food restraurants withing walking distance from the hotel. We stayed in a 2 bed suite on the 28th floor( Great Views of the city!). It had 2 queen size beds with sitting area, a small kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and surprise.. plates, glasses, forks, spoons, salt and pepper shaker, and 2 free (yes free!)bottled waters. They also had a shuttle bus that would take you where you wanted to go downtown. The bus took us to the harbor and when we wanted to come back to the hotel, we called the cell number that the driver give us and he picked us up. The only draw back for this hotel is the shower pipes. When someone takes a shower, the pipes bang loud! Very loud. Even with the bathroom door closed to muffle the sound, it is loud and hearing that at 5 or 6 in the morning is scary. The first night we stayed there, I thought that they were doing construction in the building. It sounded like someone was drilling! The front desk was called and it was explained that the building was old and it was the pipes. The next night, we wanted to speak to the manager who stated that she didnt know that there was a problem with pipes and would call us back. She called back to apologize about the pipes and give us a 20% discount on the room. I dont know if the pipe problem was just on our side or the building itself. Other than the pipes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, good for the money”
Reviews.Author: jkeyser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October-November 2006. Room was comfortable and clean, but not much really outstanding. For the price, I'd probably stay here again. Some of the views from the upper floors are really nice. Some of the others from middle floors are nothing spectacular. The hotel seems to be a converted apartment building. There are lots of floors, but very few rooms per floor. The rooms (suites) are very strangely laid out. Besides the (normal size) bedroom, I had a very tiny kitchenette, a gigantic room that I guess would be called a walk-through closet, and a small bathroom. I saw one other room at the hotel with a totally different (and more usable) layout. There was free internet service, but it would intermittently drop out on me. Only one vending machine for the whole hotel, and it was broken when I went there. The staff was friendly, though, and even let me buy a coke from the employee vending machine when I discovered the broken machine after midnight. I was here for a conference at a hotel in the inner harbor (that sold out), and it took 10 minutes or less to walk a few blocks down to that area. During the day, it's totally fine. Later at night, parts of the walk felt a bit shady - nothing too bad, but I would not want my wife walking there alone. But, the hotel does have a shuttle that can take you to the inner harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate, Rough Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: Eric-02138
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights as part of a conference. It was a good deal for the group rate I got and I had no major complaints, although the hotel didn't really live up to the luxurious, "all-suite" marketing image on its website. My room was a "suite", but barely - more of a standard hotel room in the the shape of an "J" with the extra space accomodating a small round dining table and a tiny kitchenette (microwave oven, small fridge, a few basic dishes). Good points: Comfortable bed and clean room; friendly and efficient staff; thePlaza Deli downstairs which had very good food and snacks. Dissapointments: Slightly run-down furniture; one electrical outlet didn't work; hotel elevators were REALLY slow and many guests seemed frustrated by them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur510
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. This hotel has 37 floors and our view of Baltimore from up high was fabulous. Our room had a queen bed, sofabed, mini-fridge, desk and chairs and decent-sized bathroom. I was most impressed with the view, the size of the room and the spotless bathroom. I was displeased with the carpet because it was a bit dirty and our linen which also could have been cleaner. Both the carpet and the linen had a few stains, which I didn't care for at all. The location of the hotel is great. You can walk to the harbor in 10 minutes and there are parking garages nearby. Also, the doormen were great and forthcoming with useful information. There is a restaurant in the hotel and a small food shop/cafe. I didn't go into the food shop/cafe, but there seemed to be a large variety of things to be bought. Overall, I enjoyed my stay there, but cleaner linens and carpet would have made things even better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mb56
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect since past reviews were all over the place. Check in went smoothly despite rude customer practically yelling at a very patient desk clerk. We had a lovely room overlooking the harbor that was clean and comfortable. Two bottles of water were complimentary. Rooms are mini-suites with a small kitchenette that was well stocked if you prefer to fix own meals or snacks. Bartender at Tug's (located on property) was terrific. Staff was always courteous, helpful and friendly. Hotel is within easy walking distance to most Baltimore attractions. Parking is adjacent to the hotel. Based on our experience I would recommend this hotel to travellers to the Baltimore area especially if plush and posh are not necessarily something you expect but comfort, cleanliness, and a friendly staff are important.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jaz2000
Reviews.Content: My husband just returned from a one night stay at the Tremont Plaza on St. Paul Place (June 25th). My husband won a free one night stay at the hotel through a golf tournament last fall, so we decided to redeem it before the expiration date. We live in the Baltimore suburbs, so it was a treat to spend the night in the city and explore some areas we haven't visted yet. Unfortunately, the area was under some severe weather - lots of rain and lightning, so we spent most of our time indoors. We stayed in on the 32nd floor (out of 36) and overlooked Charles Street. The room was a suite with a living room area and kitchenette. The bedroom was quite small, and they gave us a full-sized bed -- just barely big enough for the 2 of us. We wre disappointed that we weren't given a king bed, but since we were staying only 1 night, it wasn't a big deal. The bed was quite uncomfortable (too soft and springy) and there were some stains on the bedspread. that was pretty gross, so I took it off and left it on the couch in the living room. Overall, the accomodations were just okay. The room was pretty clean, but not huge. There weren't too many extra ammenities, though the kichenette w/ microwave, fridge, and toaster were a plus. The location is fine, just across from Mercy Hospital. It is a few blocks away from the Inner Harbor, but a cab ride is no more than $5.00. Our cab ride to Fell's Point (we had dinner at Black Olive) was $5.80 plus tip. There is plenty of parking in the garage next door ($15 max/day). The elevator service was fine, no long waits at all. The fitness room is underwhelming, with very basic (and old) cardio equipment. The breakfast at the downstairs deli is pretty good and decently priced (I had a croissant egg sandwhich). I probably wouldn't return to this hotel, but if we won a free night again, I would reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Nothing really special about it.”
Reviews.Author: firstkms
Reviews.Content: While this hotel didn't blow me away, I thought it was okay. It wasn't the cheapest hotel at $150 a night but it was fine for my wife and I who decided to visit Baltimore for a weekend. I liked the fact that they offered free wired internet service for labtops in the rooms. We were in 3408 floor and it was nice to have a small kitchenette. THe pool is pretty small and probably only gets direct sunlight for about 2 hours a day. THe fitness center is a joke. It had a couple of treadmills and nothing else. We were disappointed with the speed of the valet service. We must have called for our car 20 minutes prior to check out and we still waited at least another 20 minutes. WHile this hotel was about 6 blocks away from the Inner Harbor, I'm not convinced it was worth the cost. I'd consider staying somewhere else befroe staying here again. I will say that having the deli downstairs is convenient. Just wished it was open past 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Rooms, but horrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolf32
Reviews.Content: I had reservations at this hotel for a conference I was attending. When I tried to check in around 1pm, I was informed that "my group" had been moved to another hotel a few blocks away because they were over sold. I had made a reservation 3 months earlier and had a confirmation number. When I told the clerk that I had a confirmed reservation, was traveling alone and was not going to accept being moved a few blocks away since my meetings were in the hotel she got the supervisor. The supervisor informed me she could give me a smoking room, which I accepted. I had to wait another 3 hours before they would let me in my room, which to my surprise was a non-smoking room. I will say the room was nice, but after having to argue and complain to get a room I was completely turned off by this place. This is a 37 floor hotel, and honestly I don't think there was anyone else staying on my floor. I never heard a door close or had any trouble getting an elevator, so I'm not sure why all the drama at check-in. Several other attendees at the conference received the same treatment. I never felt at ease or comfortable in this hotel because of the attitude of the staff. I was also completely grossed out by a ledge in one of the meeting rooms that was covered either with mouse droppings or dead bugs - I was afraid to get too close to look. I think this hotel is way over-priced and felt like I was staying in a glorified YMCA or hostel. There is no lobby to speak of, the food from room service and in the restaurant was mediocre and it's in a terrible location. Thank heavens my company paid for the night, because I would have left if I was spending my own money!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Forget to frequent the Plaza Deli”
Reviews.Author: jesbribraali
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the staff was excellent, and the Plaza Deli was a delight. The location was ideal. A healthy, but manageable distance the convention center. Walgreens nearby for pantry items. (Fridge and Micro included in rooms were great). We were there with a sports team, and were welcomed with open arms. We were given information on local transportation options, excellent recommendations for restaurants, etc. This is a great place to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “More stressed when I left than when I came in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am at present in room 3606 and am cursing my choice of hotels.I checked in in the afternoon,starving and ordered roomservice which came so late that I was past hunger ..i let it go ...then the deli which is supposed to be open till 10 pm closes at 8 pm and I am forced to go to the restaurant (no room service again thanks) ..i said OK fair enough...the fitness "center " is PATHETIC AND (this takes the cake) the toilet in my room has been clogged for 3 hours now and NOONE has fixed it and when i called the frontdesk noone answered so I went down and complained ...and STILL noone...then I called and raised hell and THEN they tell me that there is ONLY ONE maitainence guy for BOTH the Tremont Hotels...and SUGGEST that i go to the 2nd or 4th floors to use the restrooms... I have stayed at several hotels before and this is seriously the WORST...i'll take hampton inn or comfort inn anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Cherrysarah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, my boyfriend and I took a friend's daughter to the aquarium and the room offered just the right amount of privacy. Spacious room for a great price only five blocks from the inner harbor. The deli downstairs was FANTASTIC and reallisticly priced, not charging outrageous hotel rates for simple things. On another note, the hotel staff was GREAT. I came down with a tooth ache in the middle of the night, and Dean at the front desk offered Orajel from his personal bag so we didn't even have to leave the hotel. I would definetely stay again...GREAT VALUE...GREAT HOTEL...WONDERFUL STAFF

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for conferences and events”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is a great place for conferences. The guest rooms were very nice with good views of the city, but what really stood out was the Tremont Grand. The Grand is connected to the Plaza so it is very convenient for conferences, meetings, weddings, etc. The Tremont Plaza provided guests with directions as to where the meeting would be held and were very helpful. The Tremont Grand is beautiful and would highly reccommend it to planners. The rooms are historically beautiful. Danielle in catering is great, very detailed oriented, and great at accomidating our needs.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Deal in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: roadskolar
Reviews.Content: We spent the last three nights of 2005 at the Tremont Plaza Hotel and were extremely pleased with the room, the attitude of the staff, and the location. The room was quite large and very clean, with a small fridge and a microwave, and had a lovely view of East Baltimore (we were on the 37th floor). The elevator service was good, the staff was quite friendly, and we could walk to many good restaurants on Charles Street as well as to several museums,a theatre and, of course, the highlight of downtown Baltimore, the Harbor Place (and Little Italy, too.) The lobby level deli, open from 6:30am to 8pm offered good sit down or take out food, including wine and desserts. We got a great price online of $84 plus tax with New Years Eve being about 50 percent more. PS On street free parking right across the street from the hotel is available all weekends and after 7pm weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere in Bal'more”
Reviews.Author: lbdivorcelaw
Reviews.Content: The Tremonts is an old apartment building renovated to serve as a hotel - but I don't think the concept really works. The lobby is tiny. Why? Becuase it was an apartment building and not meant as a hotel where the lobby should comfortably serve as a resting place for travelers and those wanting to relax from a long day. The rooms should their age - my bathroom had mold all over the ceiling and the closet area - that is fine at the Best Western, but not at a self-described luxury hotel. But the worst part was that the catering staff, housekeeping, etc all use the same elevators as the guests - because it was an apartment building. This makes for miserable trips up and down 33 floors.
