We waited for elevators for over 10 minutes at some points - and whenever we did get on an elevator, there was a cart full of Pepsi or two day old french fries and eggs. Baltimore is a great little city with a ton of charm, stay in a B&B over in Fells Point or even in one of the higher end chain hotels on the Harbor - the Tremonts just isn't anythign special.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Option”
Reviews.Author: jonah96
Reviews.Content: Before sharing my thoughts on Tremont Plaza, I'd like to explain my view on hotel/travel ratings in general, because I've learned that we all have our own perspective on the world - i.e., what one might consider fully acceptable, another might find totally unacceptable. First, I’ve stayed in accommodations ranging from seedy youth hostels in Bangkok, Thailand to 4-star resorts in New York City, so I’ve learned to tolerate a wide range of circumstances of the years. Second, cleanliness and a comfortable bed are about my only real concerns when I stay at a hotel, so things such as the size of the room and the number of amenities are of little concern to me (unless I’m traveling on business). Finally, I rate accommodations based on their relative value, meaning that a youth hostel has as much of an opportunity to earn a "5 out of 5" rating from me as does the most luxurious hotel on the planet, provided that it is in the top tier of its accommodation class (in my opinion, of course). Given those guidelines, the Tremont Plaza Hotel is a good choice for the price. In fact, most of the positive aspects of the hotel have already been covered in other reviews, so there’s no sense in repeating them here. However, I would like to offer an alternative view to some of the negative comments I have read in some of the more recent reviews. First, unlike some other reviewers, I found the front desk staff, concierge, and housekeeping staff all very friendly and helpful. I was at the hotel for five days, and throughout my stay, day or night, weekday or weekend, all staff members were great. I received recommendations on restaurants, directions to a variety of places, and efficient calls for taxis. Very good. Second, the internet connection in my room was fine. They provide an Ethernet cable to connect your laptop if you don’t have one (inside the desk drawer – wireless only in the deli and lounge areas downstairs), and the speed is more than adequate. It is certainly faster than dial-up, and comparable to many public high-speed connections. Since there are too many variables that can affect connection speed, I think it is unreasonable to conclude that the hotel’s connection is the problem, at least solely. (By the way, the TV reception and variety of channels were fine, too). Third, I stayed on the 34th floor (of 37), and I had no issues with long elevator wait times, neither during peak nor non-peak times. The longest I waited was about 2 minutes, and that was only once, during a very busy business Friday morning. Otherwise, the elevators were very efficient. On a related note, one of my favorite aspects of the hotel is its floor layout. There are four adjacent elevators along the west wall of a long narrow hallway, with the rooms surrounding them. Since there are only nine rooms per floor, none is more than a few feet from the elevators, which is especially convenient if you have a lot of luggage or limited mobility. Equally, the limited number of rooms and foot traffic also keep rooms quiet despite their proximity to the elevators. Very good layout. Fourth, regarding the shower/bathroom, I had very hot water, good water pressure, and was provided excellent amenities. Speaking of which, the hotel also includes two 17 oz. (500 ml) complimentary bottles of water, along with tea, coffee, and the USA Today (weekdays only). There’s also a convenience store (7-11) and two drug stores (Walgreen's and CVS) within a few blocks if you’d like to buy additional items to store in your fridge during your stay. Fifth, one reviewer mentioned the hotel being “uphill” from the harbor. In the strictest sense, I suppose that is true, but it is a mild grade. Again, I realize we all have different opinions, but concern of the grade from the Inner Harbor to the hotel is NOT a reason not to stay here. On the contrary, if this particular slope is too steep for you, then you won’t be doing much walking around town anyway. I guess that’s about it. In closing, the only reason I do not give Tremont Plaza a 5 out of 5 is because of the immediate surroundings. While appearing to be safe, they still aren’t the best. Beggars do appear here and there and there is a seedy strip club district a few blocks southeast of the hotel. However, if it’s any consolation, they are the friendliest beggars I’ve ever met(!) and there is no reason you’d have to walk through the strip club area unless you chose to. In short, then, I felt perfectly comfortable, but I can imagine some folks (e.g., elderly couples or females traveling alone) may feel more vulnerable walking around at night (day time is an absolute non-issue). Other than that, I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check your sheets!”
Reviews.Author: HotelShark
Reviews.Content: I'm currently in room 3509 and debating whether to move rooms. I checked in this afternoon and was met by a very surly attendant whom I will only identify by her first initial, J who was very unhappy about moving me into a King non-smoking which was what I booked originally. I finally did get in later that afternoon but was dismayed by the condition of the bed. As a reference, I have been travelling for the past three months and have stayed at Westin's to Hampton Inn's so at this point, I know what the value for my room should be and this was just not what I expected from the Tremont St. Paul. I was here earlier this year in April and had a fab room and don't get me wrong, they have made some great renovations to the hotel. The pub's great and the hotel is close to the Inner Harbor as well as a good number of restaurants..May I suggest Mick O'Shea's? The root of my problem is housekeeping. My bed had clearly been slept in and whoever cleaned the room before I checked in had just pulled the blanket and cover over, fluffed the pillows, replaced the towels and declared the room ready for check in. It's 11pm right now and I have just replaced my sheets. I went down to the front desk to complain and at that pont was exhausted so I changed my sheets myself, had to call back down for fresh pillowcases. In the process of changing my sheets, I pulled back the coffee stained duvet. I just had the night housekeeping staff come in and they too were horrified by what they saw and promptly replaced it. I asked for a manager to come up but the front desk said no one was present and wouldn't I just prefer to move rooms. Ummm, no..I just changed the freaking bed. I'm not about to go though that again. I was at the Tremont E Pleasant last night and this hotel is a step up but they have had convention after convention after convention come through so I wonder if they are going to adjust their standards as such and have people pass through and get as much money as they can while they sacrifice their standards. I paid full price for my room. I will not be staying here again. Night staff are amazing though.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Neil1305
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site,we decided to stay here for a few days last month,while on vacation. Despite the fact that not all reviews were completely favourable we were quite happy with our visit We booked a 1 room suite and it was absolutely huge! Also had a fridge and microwave which was useful. The deli on the ground floor was very helpful for "stocking up" on little items and beer etc. Had breakfast and a drink in "Tugs" restaurant,but not particularly impressed. It was an easy walk to the harbor and not too far to walk back. Unlike some other residents we saw the shuttle bus on quite a few occasions and actually used it to take us to the Amtrak station. We enjoyed our visit to Baltimore,especially the harbor area and the water taxi trip. It is a good way to get a feel for the city without taking a formal tour. We got a "tour" of the Washington monument area from a very friendly local resident with a good knowledge of the city,which we found very helpful. I agree with a previous posting that there aren't a great deal of bars,restaurants and delis etc in the immediate area around the hotel,but we didn't find that a great problem.

HotelInfo.Name: Tremont Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 222 St Paul Place, Baltimore, MD 21202
